loans.name: Yudi

texts.es: Yudy  de 35 años , es madre soltera ya que tiene 2 hijos .Reside en una vivienda construida  a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler.Yudy se dedica a brindar el servicio de fotocopiado e impresiones.Anteriormente se desempeñaba como ama de casa, no obstante el deseo de superación le obligo a buscar un negocio con el cual fuera posible sacar adelante a su familia.Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es el de trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza para posteriormente ser propietaria de la vivienda que ocupa en alquiler cuyo propietario son sus anteriores suegros, quienes desean vender dicho inmueble.Este viene a ser su primer crédito otorgado por Kiva.Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles con el objetivo de realizar un mantenimiento preventivo a su maquina fotocopiadora así como adquirir un nuevo cartucho de tinta, el dinero restante lo invertirá en la compra de mas golosinas y bebidas para mantener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Yudy, who is 35, is a single mother with two children. She lives in a home she rents, which is built with quality materials. Yudy works providing copying and printing services. She used to be a homemaker, but her desire to improve herself made her find a business that would allow her to provide for her family. 

One of her main long-term goals is to keep working with her usual motivation, so that she can one day become the owner of the home she now rents, which belongs to her old parents-in-law, who are looking to sell the property. 

This is her first loan through Kiva. She wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles in order to do preventive maintenance on her photocopying machine as well as purchase a new ink cartridge. She will invest the rest of the money in buying more drinks and sweets to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase ink cartridges, sweets, and drinks.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lilia owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  

In the future, Lilia wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29-year-old married man with two children. He describes himself as an honest man. 

Paul is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more sugar, cooking fat, salt and other items for his shop. His challenges are inadequate capital, which causes his business not to grow. He wants to focus on the shop; that would help him get money to sustain his family. 

He sees himself in five years established to have a supermarket located in his area of Nakuru town.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking fat, salt and other items for his shop.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married 26-year-old with three children. She describes herself as a competent, self-esteemed, and focused wholesaler. She is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 through SMEP DTM to buy sugar, salt, flour and other items for her shop. This will enable her to have a variety of products. 

She is also is engaged in a farming business planting food crops that are supplied to a Nakuru market. She sees herself as a wholesaler operating chains of stores, thus improving her family economically.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, flour and other items for her shop

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora de 51 años y que a pesar de su edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ella es comerciante y agricultora de su propio producto, casada y con 3 hijos ya mayores de edad cada quien con su familia y apartado en hogar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace muchos años ya que esta actividad ha sido medio de sustento para su familia y lo sigue siendo para ella hoy en día con la ayuda de sus hijos que contribuyen a dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café como: poda, limpieza, corte y fertilización del mismo. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos, personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local y otros. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 1.5 Kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación.

Doña Maria solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, y una bomba de fumigación para su cultivo de café, ya que hoy en día esta clase de productos son caros y la (roya) que es un hongo dañino de no ser tratado a tiempo contamina y daña una cosecha completa.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones como hasta el día de hoy se hace formando un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Maria is a fighter and an entrepreneurial woman who is 51 years old. In spite of her age, she has not stopped dreaming big. She is a merchant and farms her own product. She is married and has 3 grown children, each one with their own family and separate home. She has been a farmer for many years, since this activity has been the method of sustaining her family, and it continues to be for herself today with the help of her children, who contribute to the maintenance of her coffee crops by pruning, cleaning, cutting, and fertilizing. Her product is sold in the areas near her home to some neighbors, small-scale merchants in the local market, and others. Her crops are located 1.5 kilometers from her house.

Maria is asking for help to be able to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, and a fumigation pump for her coffee crop, since nowadays these kinds of products are expensive, and the rust, which is a damaging fungus, contaminates and damages a whole harvest if it is not treated in time.

Her plans for the future are to have a large coffee plantation that can continue to bless and sustain the family and be worked generation after generation by her children, her grandchildren, and the next generations as it is today, forming a family inheritance.

loans.use: to be able to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, and a fumigation pump for her coffee crop

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia, se dedica a la venta de pan. Ella tiene 37 años de edad y disfruta de dos hijos, ellos tiene edades de 5 y 9 años, vive en casa propia  y posee la panadería como una fuente generadora de ingresos; lleva dos años de haber iniciado con el negocio y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura y aceite, entre otros productos para la elaboración del pan; esta inversión le permitirá aumentar la capacidad de generar utilidades, incrementar la clientela y sus ingresos con los cuales fortalecerá el negocio.
Su seño es optimizar los ingresos para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia sells bread for a living.  She is 37 years old and she has two wonderful children who are five and nine years old.  She lives in her own home and the bakery is her source of income.  She started her business two years ago and she works Monday through Saturday from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  

She will use this much-needed loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and oil, among other products to make bread.  This investment will allow her to increase her production capability, expand her clientele, and increase her income, all of which will strengthen her business.

Her dream is to maximize her income so she can offer her children a better education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and oil, among other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise is 20 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for a year. She applied for the loan to buy more rice and maize for resale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and maize for resale.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a 55-year-old married mother of nine children. She describes herself as a competent and committed mother who wants to provide for her family. She is applying for a KES 10,000 loan from SMEP DTM to stock her shop with items to sell, such as sugar, flour and salt. She is also engaged in farming and raising livestock at her place in the Nakuru area. Her challenges include insufficient capital for her business. She sees herself, in five years, with a large chain of shops in her area.

loans.use: to stock her shop with items to sell, including sugar, flour and salt.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita de 55 años de edad ,casada con Marcos quien es empleado, vive con su esposo en su casa propia la cual compro con la ayuda de su esposo.Emerita se dedica a la venta de libros, para esto cuenta con un local la cual está instalada en su hogar de esa manera se ahorra en gastos de alquiler, siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos y extraños que pasan por la zona, a quienes  atiende con amabilidad,  su librería lleva ya 09 años de funcionamiento tiempo en cual a llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo de su esposo para la atención del publico en sus ratos libres.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona, y que le trae ingreso económicos que le da la tranquilidad necesaria, comenta que escogió esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y sentirse una mujer productiva, por tanto  tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar  su negocio.Este sería su préstamo número 06 con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Con el préstamo de S/.2000 nuevos soles, comprará artículos diversos como cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc. para surtir su  librería  considera que a mayor variedad mas acogida tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Emerita, who is 55 years old, is married to Marcos, who is a worker. She lives with her husband in the home she purchased with his help. Emerita works selling books. Her business is set up in a space located in her home. This allows her to save on rent. Neighbors as well as strangers who come through the area keep her store busy. She serves her customers kindly. Her bookstore has been in business for nine years, and during this time it has become very well-known and popular. Her husband helps see to the customers in his free time.

What she enjoys about her work is that she became very well-known in the area and that it earns her the financial income she needs to have peace of mind. She mentions she chose this business because she needed to find a trade and feel productive, so she is very eager to keep growing and for her business to expand. This will be her sixth loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to keep going.

She will use this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase assorted items like notebooks, pencils, books, etc. to stock her bookstore. She thinks that the more variety her business can offer, the better it will be received.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, books, and other items.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando s  tiene 74 años de edad es casado tiene 9 hijos vive con  su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Chillanes 

Provincia Bolívar.




Es integrante de ventanilla azanloma  perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, la actividad económica es la 

agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.  



La comunidad se encuentra en unos 30 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa en Chillanes.  




Fernando se dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de arveja, frejol canario, panamito,  maíz  y a la 

crianza de animales como el ganado.  



Solicita el crédito para  la limpieza del cantero de caña.  





Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Chillanes.  





Su sueño es  vivir un poco mejor.   




El desafío que enfrenta es las plagas en los cultivos.  




En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear y fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Fernando is 74 years old.  He is married and has nine children.  He lives with his wife and children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

He is a member of the Azanloma Communal Bank from Chillanes Canton.  Its members work in farming, livestock, and commerce.

This community is 30 minutes from the cooperative's office in Chillanes.

Fernando works in farming for a living, growing peas, canary beans, kidney beans, and corn, and he also raises animals, such as cattle. 

She is asking for this loan to clean up his sugarcane plot.

He does his buying in the city of Chillanes.

His dream is to live a little better.

A challenge he faces is pests in his crops.

In his free time he likes to go on walks and and go to parties in the community.

loans.use: to clean up his sugarcane plot.

loans.name: Kristelle

texts.en:
Kristelle is a 22-year-old entrepreneur who has always dreamed of being her own boss and running her own business. With her strong sense of independence and drive to always be ahead of the game, she has pushed herself to this next big step. A few months ago, she woke up one Monday morning and felt stuck. She had graduated from college, landed her first full-time job, and was making OK money, but something just did not seem right. She thought it over and over and discovered that her job was not fulfilling her needs of what she had set out to do. 

Growing up, all she had ever dreamed of was being able to help people and somehow working there was not fueling her dream. That was when Creative Kids Zone LLC was born. She had previously been a private tutor throughout high school and college and loved being able to help students who were struggling. Per Kristelle, “The reactions on student’s faces were priceless, especially when the student was able to understand the lesson. I remembered back to the days where I had once been ecstatic to go to work because I was helping others. Thus I conjoined my love for helping others and my experience in tutoring and Creative Kids Zone LLC was born.”

She is looking for a $9,000 microloan for the working capital she needs for her startup

loans.use: To pay for rent, marketing, business insurance and other office expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en: Annabella is married, and she works very hard to provide for her family. She enjoys operating her general store and her pig-fattening business in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Annabella has been in this business for four years, and she has previously received funds through Kiva. Annabella aspires to save money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en: Esperence is 41 years old. She is married and has five children, all of whom go to school. She sells cows and has been in this business for two years. With this loan, she wants to buy cows for resale. The profits from the cow business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is 46 years old. He lives in a small village in Gori District with his wife and three children. Albert applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Albert trades in nails. The income is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo’s evaluation, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. Albert applied for a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Albert has now been approved for the loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Albert and his wife will begin trading in fruits and vegetables. He plans to purchase fruits and vegetables from wholesalers and then resell them at higher prices. He will be able to increase the family income. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business, and he will use another part to provide a better future for his children. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis, tiene 54  años de edad, está casada con Amancio , vive en su casa propia la cual construyó con el apoyo de su esposo en compañía de sus 04 hijos y su nuera.

La actividad que realiza Gladis es la venta de comestibles en general, para eso estableció una pequeña bodega en su hogar, ahí atiende todos los días desde muy temprano de manera amable y cordial a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos con quienes tiene una relación de amistad y respeto durante los 10 años que viene funcionando su bodega.Le agrada su negocio  de ventas de abarrotes y bebidas ya que le permite estar en casa durante el día y participar en las actividades escolares de sus hijos menores, así mismo, el ingreso económico que obtiene le ayuda a solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar.Este es el crédito numero 04 con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos y seguir creciendo dia a dia .
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 nuevos  soles comprará comestibles  en general tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas descartables y bebidas envasadas a precios bajos para continuar desarrollando su actividad.
texts.en:
Gladis is 54 years old. She is married to Amancio. She lives in her own house, which she built with the help of her husband, with her 4 children and her daughter-in-law.

Gladis sells general groceries. For this, she established a small store in her home where every day starting very early she waits on all her customers in a friendly and cordial way. The majority of them are her neighbors, with whom she has had a relationship of friendship and respect for the 10 years her store has been open. She likes her business selling groceries and drinks since it lets her be at home during the day and participate in the school activities of her younger children, and also because the income she obtains helps her cover basic household expenses. This is her 4th loan with Kiva, so she hopes for your cooperation in order to continue with her goals and to keep growing every day.

With the amount requested of 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy general groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, sweets, bottled soda, and bottled drinks at low prices in order to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, and pasta, among others

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 43 años de edad  es casada tiene 7 hijos vive con sus hijos y su esposo en el Cantón 

Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.



Es integrante de ventanilla azanloma  perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, la actividad económica es la 

agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.  





La comunidad se encuentra en unos 30 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa en Chillanes.  




Magdalena se dedica a la a la agricultura como a la siembra de frejol, maíz y a la crianza de  animales como 

los ganados, cerdos y pollos.  



Solicita el crédito para  la compra  de torete.  




La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes.  




Su sueño es comprar terreno en otro sector y dar el estudio a los hijos.  




El desafío que enfrenta es presencia de plagas y lanchas en los cultivos.  




En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a la familia y fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 43 years old. She is married and has seven children. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar Province.

She belongs to the Azanloma solidarity group in Cantón Chillanes. Its members work in agriculture, raising animals, and selling products. The community is located about thirty minutes from the co-op in Chillanes.  

Magdalena works as a farmer, growing beans and corn, and raising animals like cattle, pigs, and chickens. She is requesting this loan to purchase bull calves. She makes her purchases in the town of Chillanes.  

Her dream is to buy land in a different sector and give her children an education. The challenge she faces is the presence of pests and late blight on the crops. In her free time, she enjoys being with her family and participating in the local festivities.

loans.use: to purchase bull calves.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 61 años de edad,está casada con Asunción , tiene 4 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo, 02 hijos y un nieto en su casa propia la cual logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja.El trabajo que realiza Isabel es la  venta de calzados para damas, caballeros  y niños, de diversas marcas y modelos que están a la moda, los cuales trae según el gusto y el pedido que su cliente, afortunadamente tiene buena acogida por su público y no ha tenido problemas al realizar la cobranza ya que su clientela son básicamente personas que trabajan en instituciones privadas y reconoce fácilmente a aquellos que demuestran responsabilidad. Todos los productos que venden son de reconocidas marcas de calidad a nivel mundial y eso le permite obtener buenas ganancias por cada venta. Lleva realizando este trabajo  por casi 05 años, trabaja sola y con mucha alegría. Se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio estableciendo poco a poco una tienda en su propia casa.Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 nuevos soles, comprará calzados de varones y mujeres como zapatillas, zapatos y sandalias para continuar vendiendo a su exigente público.
texts.en:
Isabel, 61 years old, is married to Asunción. She has 4 children who are already grown. She lives with her husband, 2 children, and a grandchild in her own house, which she managed to build with the support of her partner. Isabel sells women's, men's, and children's shoes of various brands and styles that are in fashion. She carries them according to the taste and orders of her public. Fortunately, she is well-received by her customers and has not had problems collecting money, since her customers are basically people who work in private institutions, and she easily recognizes those who demonstrate responsibility. All of the products she sells are recognized worldwide as quality brands, and this allows her to obtain good earnings on each sale. She has been doing this work for almost 5 years. She works alone and very happily. She feels happy because it has brought her a lot of satisfaction, and she wants to continue working and to improve her business, establishing a store in her own house bit by bit. This is her 5th loan with Kiva, so she thanks those who make her loan possible so that she can continue with her goals. On the other hand, she promises to be punctual with her loan repayments. 

With the amount requested of 2500 nuevos soles, she will buy men's and women's shoes such as tennis shoes, shoes, and sandals in order to continue selling to her demanding public.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes, shoes, and sandals

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 32, is married and has a child. He currently offers transport services to customers using his motorcycle. He describes himself as a tolerant and patient father and individual.

Joseph successfully repaid a loan of 40,000 KES. He is now applying for a 30,000 KES loan with SMEP DTM to open a retail shop. His anticipated profits will be used to improve his shop and buy a plot of land.

In five years Joseph sees himself as a taxi operator in his neighborhood in west Nairobi.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 35 años de edad , esta casada con Kleiver con quien construyo su hogar a base de material noble. Se dedica a la venta de diversas prendas de vestir tales como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.
Es una labor donde es necesario  estar presente en el trascurso del día para recibir a su distinguida clientela quienes son principalmente agricultores de las zonas rurales de su localidad y población en general. 
En ocasiones cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ya que aveces es necesario ausentarse para desempeñar otras tareas pendientes evitando descuidar su negocio.
Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es el de ampliar su negocio hasta aperturar un negocio del mismo rubro pero en una local propio preferentemente ubicado en una avenida principal de su localidad.Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo financiero recibido.
Desea contar con 2,500 nuevo soles y adquirir mas prendas de vestir tales como polos para damas, pantalones y demás prendas con mayor demanda entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teofila, 35, is married to Kleiver, with whom she built her house of solid materials.

She makes a living selling various garments such as clothing for women, men, and children.  It's a job where she needs to be present throughout the day to welcome her distinguished customers, who are mainly farmers from the rural areas of her town as well as the general population.  Sometimes she has the help of her husband when it's necessary for her to be gone to carry out other tasks, and she doesn't want to ignore her business.

One of her main long-term goals is to expand her business and open another business of the same type but in her own locale, preferably on a main street in her town.

This is her second Kiva loan and she's very grateful for the financial support received.  She wants to have 2,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to get more women's polo shirts, pants, and other garments with high demand among her customers.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, pants, and other clothing

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 38 años de edad , vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia .El negocio que tiene Marina es la venta de comidas. Todos las mañanas  instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres y ofertas todos sus comidas preparadas, además de refrescos, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes son en su mayoría sus propios vecinos y personas que llegan por recomendación.
Además comenta que le gusta su negocio pues conoce de cocina y decidió a empezar por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y tener un oficio ya que no le alcanzaba el dinero y tenía apuros económicos.
Ahora viendo los buenos resultados desea ampliarse y abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres.Este es el crédito número 03  con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un poyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevo soles,comprará ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de comidas tales como arroz , verduras y carnes, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras y así continuar con éste  negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina, 38 years old, lives with her husband and her two children in her own house. Her business is selling food. Every morning, she installs her table in front of her parents' house and offers all of her prepared food as well as soft drinks and waits on her customers in a very friendly way. The majority of them are her own neighbors and people who come based on recommendations.

She also says that she likes her business because she knows cooking. She decided to start due to the need to have her own income and a job, since there was not enough money and she had financial difficulties.

Now, seeing the good results, she wants to expand and open a store selling groceries in her parents' house. This is her third loan with Kiva. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since this way she feels secure moving forward with her business.

With the amount requested of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy ingredients and supplies to prepare food such as rice, vegetables, and meat, looking for comfortable prices for her purchases, and thus continuing with this business and increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 39, is married and has three children. She describes herself as an honest woman.

This will be Eunice’s second loan through SMEP DTM; she repaid the first successfully. She is applying for a 30,000 KES loan to enable her to buy more stock for her grocery shop. She plans to pay off the loan in installments.

She sees her store in five years as a large enough business to be able to supply groceries to her region.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children. She describes herself as a patient woman. 

Elizabeth is applying for a KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, cooking fat and flour for her shop. This is her fifth successive loan with SMEP DTM, the previous being KES 20,000. Previous loans were paid successfully. The products sold include soap, sugar and salt. 

The future business of her family is to educate them and give them a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking fat and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Ma. Rena

texts.en:
Ma. Rena is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. Ma. Rena is engaged in a food vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place.

Ma. Rena is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, cooking margarine and other ingredients. With this, she will be able to cook more and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Ma. Rena hopes to expand her business, save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, cooking margarine and other ingredients.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man who describes himself as outgoing. He is requesting a loan to repair the motorcycle that he operates in the town of Thika. This is his seventh loan through SMEP DTM. His previous loan amount of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) was paid successfully. He is now requesting another loan of 30,000 KES.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Armando José

texts.es: Don Armando, casado padre de familia de tres hijos, quienes estudian y le ayudan a su padre en el taller de costura al igual que su esposa, así ellos unidos cubren los gastos principales del hogar como la alimentación, gastos de colegio entre otros, aunque a veces don Armando ha tenido dificultades con las maquinas de cocer por los cuales a veces no avanza con los pedidos por este inconveniente y reponerlos le sale caro. Con este quinto crédito desea comprar tela y accesorios para poder hacer costuras y vender.
texts.en:
Don Armando is married and the father of three children who study and help him with his tailing shop. His wife helps out as well. With this business, they are able to cover the main household expenses such as food, school costs, and other items.

Don Armando occasionally has difficulties with his sewing machines, so sometimes he is not able to proceed with the completion of his orders. Replacing his equipment will be expensive. With the fifth loan he is requesting, Armando will buy fabrics and accessories so that he can continue sewing and selling his products.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and accessories.

loans.name: Angel Salomon

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 47 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el Cantón  Chillanes Provincia 

Bolívar.




Es integrante de ventanilla azanloma  perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, la actividad económica es la 

agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.  



La comunidad se encuentra en unos 30 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa en Chillanes.  




Ángel se dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de frejol,  maíz y a la crianza de animales como  los 

ganados y   los cerdos. 




Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. 




La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes. 




Su sueño es comprar un solar de terreno por el pueblo.  




El desafío que enfrenta es  presencia de plagas, mucho invierno y las lanchas.  




En el tiempo  libre le gusta realizar deporte como el bolí y el indor y las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Ángel, 47, is married and lives with his wife and their four children in the canton of Chillanes, which is located in the province of Bolívar. He is a member of the Azanloma communal bank, which belongs to the canton of Chillanes. His business activities are agriculture, raising animals, and trade. The community is located thirty minutes away from the cooperative's office in Chillanes.

Ángel makes a living in agriculture by planting beans, rice, and raising animals such as cattle and pigs. He has applied for this loan to buy livestock. He makes his purchases in the city of Chillanes. 

His dream is to buy a plot of land around his town. The challenges which he faces are the presence of infestations, long winters, and blight. In his free time, he likes to play sports such as volleyball and indoor soccer and go to parties in his village.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 63 years old. He lives in Gori district with his 58-year-old wife, Eliso. Their main source of income is from their farm. They own a plot of land where they grow maize, haricots and onions. They sell their harvest at the local markets from which they derive a small monthly income.

Nodar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of the couple’s low income and their poor living conditions.

Nodar then requested a 800 GEL start-up loan from Credo. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as high-risk borrowers due to low incomes.

With his credit Nodar will start trading in walnuts. He will buy them from the growers and then sell them at the local markets at a mark-up. This new business will result in good profits for him. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the couple’s living conditions.

loans.use: to start trading in walnuts.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet, at the age of 52, is a widowed mother of four children whom are currently employed as garment workers to financially support the family. From Yet's house situated in Reussey Keo district, she owns a business of producing hammocks and retails them to those who live in the surrounding areas. She has been doing this for almost 13 years and earns approximately USD 1.50 per day.

This is the first loan that she has received through HKL. She intends to use it for her daughter’s wedding party, which will incur heavy expenses. Yet has never received previous loans from other local State banks, but HKL provides her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. She is very pleased and thankful for the loan, which will enable her to manage the costs in the wedding of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s wedding party.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. She describes herself as an aggressive, motivated, and jolly mother. 

Diana will use the loan to buy beauty salon equipment for her salon. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy beauty salon equipment. This is her second loan; the previous loan was paid successfully. She is also a farmer in Machakos area.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Carpo

texts.en:
Carpo has earned a living through his welding and metal fabricating business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Carpo is asking for a loan to buy materials for welding and metal fabrication, such as plate metal and iron bars. Through this, he will be able to improve his business thus augmenting his income.

Carpo hopes to make his business venture successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials for welding and metal fabrication, such as plate metal and iron bars.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 28-year-old married mother of two. She runs a restaurant that sells food and beverages. She describes herself as a hard-working and tolerant mother. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase a plot and construct residential houses. She is applying for a 20,000 KES loan to expand the restaurant. In five years she sees herself having more staff and running a fast food restaurant.

loans.use: To expand the restaurant

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia runs a sari-sari store or a small grocery store in her place in Talibon, Bohol. Cecelia has been in the business for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. Cecelia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Cecelia is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, soap, and detergents. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Cecelia dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, soap, and detergents.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married mother of four children. She has been running a grocery store business for three years. She describes herself as a courageous person. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000. The loan will be used to expand the rental houses business, which she also owns. She has been in business for three years, and she describes the business environment as competitive. 

The challenge she faces on this business is inadequate capital.

loans.use: To expand her rental houses.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica al negocio de transporte de pasajeros, lo cual lo realiza en un microbús y viajes expresos; realiza esta actividad  desde hace cinco años y lo lleva a cabo de lunes a sábado. El tiene 41 años de edad, está casado y su compañera de vida tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar dos llantas y para el mantenimiento del bus; este le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones del microbús y poder seguir trabajando.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan makes a living by transporting passengers in a minibus and offering express trips. He has been in this business for five years, and he works from Monday to Saturday. He is 41 years old and married. His wife is 38 years old, and they have two children.

He needs this loan to buy two tires to maintain his minibus. This will help him to improve the conditions of the minibus so that he can continue working. His dream is to strengthen his business and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two tires and maintain his minibus.

loans.name: Ninfa Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene   21 años de edad es  soltera vive con sus abuelos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.



Es integrante de ventanilla azanloma  perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, la actividad económica es la 

agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.  


La comunidad se encuentra en unos 30 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa en Chillanes.


  
Marisol se dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de maíz, frejol y a la crianza de animales como las 

gallinas, ganados y cerdos.  



Solicita el crédito para compra de ganado. 


La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes.  



Su  sueño es seguir estudiado. 




El desafío que enfrenta es plagas en el cultivo. 





En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música, ver televisión y las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Marisol, 21, is single and lives with her grandparents in the canton of Chillanes, which is located in the province of Bolivar. She is a member of the Azanloma communal bank in the canton of Chillanes. Her business activities are agriculture, raising animals, and trade. The community is located thirty minutes away from the cooperative's office in Chillanes.

Marisol makes a living in agriculture by planting corn and beans and raising animals such as chickens, cattle, and pigs. She has applied for this credit to buy livestock. She makes her purchases in the city of Chillanes.
 
Her dream is to continue studying. The challenge which she faces is infestation in her crops. In her free time, she likes to listen to music, watch television, and go to parties in her community.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 63 años de edad, esta casada con Dennis con quien vive en su casa propia.Las actividades que realiza Yolanda son la venta de ropas de segunda mano la cual compra en los centros comerciales de la ciudad, y los lleva a vender por los caseríos ubicados en los márgenes del los ríos, realizando ésta actividad desde hace 02 años, pero tambien se dedica a la pesca para lo cual cuenta con un bote pesquero con todos su materiales tales como redes y tramperas .Le gusta su actividades ya que la mantiene ocupada y obtiene ingresos económicps para su familia.Este será el primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles tiene planes de invertir en la compra de ropas de segundo uso a precio por mayor, así como comprar materiales para pesca como tramperas y redes.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 63, is married to Dennis whom she lives with, in their own house. Yolanda sells second hand clothing which she buys at shopping centres in the city. She takes them to sell in small villages located on the banks of rivers. She has been doing this work for 2 years and she also fishes. She has a fishing boat with all the equipment such as nets and traps. She likes her activities since it keeps her occupied and she obtains an income for her family. 

This will be her first loan with Kiva, so she hopes for your co-operation, to continue with her goals. With the requested amount of 1000 Peruvian Soles she has plans to invest it in the purchase of second hand clothing at wholesale, as well as to buy fishing equipment like traps and nets.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothing and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Ivette Del Socorro

texts.es: Ivette, es dueña de una pulpería, habita en la ciudad de Granada, es casada, madre de 4 hijos, su negocio lo empezó desde hace 7 años. Ella dice que comenzó vendiendo dulces, snacks, y pan conforme el tiempo fue pasando le fue agregando nuevos productos la ganancia que obtenía la iba invirtiendo en la pulpería hasta logra formarla con más productos que sus clientes a diario le solicitaban. Hoy está requiriendo el crédito para comprar granos básicos, cosmético, verduras y ropa.  Pues ha notado que entre más productos variados ofrezca es atractivo para atraer clientela. Se ha propuesto mejorar la infraestructura  de su pulpería y comprar estantes para exhibir sus productos. Su meta es darles un techo digno a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ivette owns a small grocery store. She lives in the city of Granada, and she is married and the mother of 4 children. She started her business 7 years ago. She says that she started out selling sweets, snacks, and bread. As time passed, she added new products. She invested her earnings in the store until she was able to stock it with more products that her customers were asking for her every day. Today she needs the loan to buy staple grains, cosmetics, vegetables, and clothing, since she has noticed that offering more of a variety of products is attractive to customers. She has decided to improve her store's infrastructure and buy display cases to exhibit her products. Her goal is to give her children a respectable home.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, cosmetics, vegetables, and clothing

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Eliasi is a married man in his mid-30s with three children who are in school. For the past four years he has been running two food businesses, Cafe and Chips. He works from 11:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit each month.

This will be Eliasi’s sixth loan through Tujijenge Tanzania; his previous loans were all paid back successfully. He is applying for a 6,590,000 TZS to be shared by his loan group "Faith," which totals fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

With his previous loan portions Eliasi added a super-sport dish for football fans and other related games and programs to attract more customers. He also restocked food items like sodas, water, juices, meat, fish and bananas .

With his profits he bought a plot of land upon which he expects to start building, covered school fees and bought a cupboard for his home. He plans to use this loan to repair his business premises and restock inventory. His ambition is to be able to build a house and expand his businesses.

loans.use: to repair his business premises and restock inventory.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 42 years old, and married with six children. She lives in Tukuran, Misamis Occidental. 

Lolita owns and operates a fishing business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years, and earns 8,000PHP every month. She  joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy materials for fishing.  

In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house, and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is a 40-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for two years, and he started the business to supplement his farming activities which were seasonal and could not meet his family's basic needs.

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect his business.  His dreams are to do business in wholesale, and to educate his children up to the University level.

Edison intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en: Cerelina is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Cerelina has operated a sari-sari store for more than 20 years now. She sells various goods and items to the people in her area. Cerelina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of items to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, candies, soap and toiletries, and to pay for the repair of the house. Through this loan, Cerelina will be able to improve her store and house. In the future, Cerelina has hopes of making her business successful and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items like canned goods, biscuits, candies, soap and toiletries to sell, and to pay for the repair of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stocks of potatoes, tomatoes and other groceries.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a married man with eight children, all of whom attend school. Together with his children, he lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He has operated a fish selling business for the past two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passers-by. He faces the major challenges of expensive transportation and stiff competition.

With the 15,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase bundles of fish to resell. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to resell.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is forty years old and has a small grocery shop. She is applying for a 300,000 RWF loan through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy more rice and maize flour to sell. She plans to put her profits toward building a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice and maize to sell.

loans.name: Cresanta

texts.en:
Cresanta is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. 

Cresanta, together with her husband, has been engaged in a rent-a-car business for more than 12 years. This is the source of their income. 

She is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the vehicle, and to renew the registration of the van. She believes that this loan could help them improve their business and income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the vehicle and to renew the registration of the van.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a female Ugandan living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She is married with two children.

Sylvia sells fresh foods, and with the proceeds she has been able to provide the basics to her family. Lack of adequate preservation equipment causes most of her foods to go bad; her dream is to buy a refrigerator. 

Her personal goal is to educate her children up to the University level, even though she did not have a chance to go to school since her parents were poor.

Sylvia intends to use the loan to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah, a 52-year-old mother of five, describes herself as an ambitious woman who wants to give her children a comfortable life. Keziah owns a shop in Nakuru that sells sugar, flour, etc. She describes the market environment as having potential, and would like to have a supermarket within five years.

Facing the challenge of inadequate funds, Keziah is requesting a loan of kes 10,000 to buy more sugar, flour and other items for her shop. This will be her first loan through SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour and other items for her shop.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia, de 43 años de edad, esta casada con Gerardo quien es agricultor, con él tiene 02 hijos y junto a ellos vive en su casa propia .El trabajo de Aurelia consiste en la venta de jugos y tambien tiene un  taller de soldadura . Tiene un puesto de ventas en el mercado principal de su localidad en donde trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano preparando todo tipo de desayunos. Lleva en este negocio 06 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su hija mayor.Comparte esta actividad con otro negocio en el que se desempeña por las tardes de manera ocasional el cual es un taller de soldadura que aperturó hace 06 meses y en el que principalmente trabaja su esposo .Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar en contacto constante con el público, le gusta conocer las preferencias de sus clientes y que es lo que demandan para que pueda seguir mejorando, además de eso la rentabilidad que recibe por ambas actividades .Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable con sus pagos ..
Con el préstamo solicitado de 3500 nuevos soles comprará una máquina de soldadura con el que espera desarrollar un mejor trabajo en su taller y brindar un servicio de calidad,pero tambien invertirá un pequeño monto en la compra de frutas.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 43, is married to Gerardo, who is a farmer. Together, they have two children, with whom they live in their own house. 

Aurelia's work consists of selling juice, and she also has a welding workshop. She has a stall in the main market of her town, where she works every day from the early morning preparing various types of breakfast food. She has been in this business for six years, and her oldest daughter helps her with the work. She shares her time between this activity and another business, the welding workshop. She opened the workshop six months ago, and she occasionally works there in the afternoons. It is mainly her husband who works there. 

What she likes about her work is that it allows her to be in contact with people constantly. She enjoys learning about her clients' preferences and what they order so that she can continue to improve. Aside from this, she enjoys the profit from her two business activities. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva. She is very touched and thankful for the financial backing that she has been offered in order to continue with her plans. She does not want to stop paying her loan back due to a lack of money, which is why she is committed to being very punctual and above all very responsible with her payments.

With the requested amount of 3500 Peruvian soles, she will buy a welding machine, with which she hopes to develop better work in her workshop and offer a quality service. She will also invest a small amount in the purchase of fruit.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and fruit.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a married father of 3 children. He describes himself as a commited parent. He plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs. He is involved in a farming business where he deals with planting of crops like potatoes, cabbages and beans. He describes the area of farming as a productive area and is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES through SMEP DTM to buy farming inputs. This is his first application for a loan. He sees himself with more land to cultivate in the near future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a married man with five children. All of his kids attend school, which is the reason that he works so hard. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Martin has operated a vegetable stall business from home for the past five years, selling to passers-by and neighbors. He cited seasonality and theft as his greatest challenges. 

With the 40,000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions. His dream is to see his children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a mother of five children. She has been in business for ten years selling potatoes. She plans to use the loan to add extra stock of potatoes for her business. She is applying for a loan of 15,000 KES through SMEP DTM. She sees herself in five years with a wholesale store. She also operates a farming business that grows vegetables.

loans.use: To increase her stock of potatoes

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es:
Rosa, 49 años de edad, es una humilde comerciante originaria de la ciudad de León, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad. Ella trabaja como conserje de limpieza en una escuela pero adicional se dedica a vender cosméticos negocio que inicio hace 4 años, cuando recibió una charla de venta de cosméticos por catálogo sus primeros productos fueron perfumes y cremas. 
Ella está requiriendo el crédito para comprar  pinturas de uña, cremas, shampo, perfumes, pinturas de labio etc. 
Rosa lucha cada dia por lograr conseguir ingresos para ir comprando poco a poco materiales de construcción y mejorar su humilde vivienda. Otro de sus proyectos es agregar la venta de ropa para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 49, is a humble merchant from the city of León. She has three children, all of whom are adults. 

She works as a janitor at a school, but she also sells cosmetics. She started this business four years ago when she heard a speech about selling cosmetics from a catalog. The first products she sold were perfume and creams. She needs this loan to buy nail polish, creams, shampoo, perfume, lipstick, etc. 

Rosa fights every day to earn an income so that little by little, she can buy construction materials to improve her humble home. Another one of her projects is adding the sale of clothing for children and adults to her business.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, creams, shampoo, perfume, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Don Dagoberto de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad actualmente ellos estudian,  Dagoberto  se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace  15 años su principal siembra es el maíz y maicillo cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía  para luego salir a comercializarlos con las personas que venden granos básicos en los mercados cerca de su lugar de residencia y cuando pasa la cosecha se dedica a jornal  a la corta de jocotes en una finca que está cerca de su casa, con las ventas de sus cosechas y con el pago de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar pero no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de su  siembra por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comparar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener una mejor cosecha y así tener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Dagoberto, 47 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their 2 children, who are 9 and 13 years old and are currently students. Dagoberto has been a farmer for 15 years. His main crops are corn and sorghum. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granary shown in the photograph to then sell to people who sell staple grains in the markets close to his place of residence. When the harvest is over he works as a day laborer cutting jocotes (a tropical fruit similar to a mango) at a farm near his house. With the sales from his crops and the money from his job, he is able to cover some of the expenses of his household, but he is not able to cover his planting expenses. This is why he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure, among other items, in order to have a better harvest and earn more to give his family what they need with no restrictions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Zahara, who is in her mid 40s, is a married woman with five children (two sons and three daughters) who are in school. She is doing fine with her family.  

Zahara has been handling her life by having two small businesses, charcoal selling and snacks.  She has been doing these for ten years. She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to earn a good profit each month. 

This will be her 8th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she managed to purchase more charcoal stock and some kilos of bakery flour. With the profit, she covered household expenses, school fees, and started building her house. 

She will use this loan to restock businesses items, and the balance for finishing her house building. She dreams of owning another business selling foods.

She will share this loan with her loan group, 'CHAMWINO'  which has 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock businesses items .

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith, tiene 19 años de edad, esta casada con José de 20 años y están a la espera de su primer hijo.
Vive en la casa de sus suegros en compañía de su esposo.Judith se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y helados de hielo, desde hace dos años siendo su hogar su centro de trabajo, se inicio en este negocio buscando mejorar su calidad de vida a lado de su esposo. Al principio se les hizo muy difícil ya que no contaban con liquidez económica para la compra de los insumos, y no tenían el lugar indicado para el negocio pero gracias al apoyo de su familia lograron abrir su negocio.Como una mujer emprendedora Judith, espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor producto y de calidad.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral.
En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.500 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas y frutas para la preparación de los helados de hielo.
texts.en:
Judith, 19, is married to José, 20, and they are expecting their first child. She lives in her in-laws' house with her husband. Judith sells soft drinks and ice cream. For two years now, her home has been her workplace. 

She began this business looking to improve her quality of life next to her husband. At the beginning it was very difficult since they did not have economic liquidity to purchase supplies, and they didn't have a place for their business but thanks to the support of their family they managed to open their business. As an enterprising woman, Judith hopes to keep going with her small business and make it grow in such a way that she can supply her customers with better products and of good quality.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the opportunity that she has been given to obtain a line of financing which will be very useful for her job performance. At this time she is requesting 500 Peruvian Soles which she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks and fruits to make ice creams.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, saplings, and other products.

loans.name: Amadeu

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É carpinteiro numa empresa e com o presente empréstimo pretende pagar e legalizar um terreno para construir a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja construir uma casa para melhor confortar a família e iniciar um negocio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e ter uma carpintaria na sua casa para obter mais rendimento.
texts.en:
A married father of 2 children who attend school, Amadeu lives in his own home and does not support anyone else.
He works as a carpenter for a company.  He intends to use the loan to buy a legally recognized plot of land to build a home.  In the future, he wants to build a better home to make his family comfortable and start a business, for this he is committed to repay the Hluvuku loan.  His goal is to work more and to have a carpentry workshop in his home to earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for a legal plot of land to construct his home.

loans.name: Sonia  Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Sonia de 40 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y loroco con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 5 años de edad,  ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su cosecha como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, pesticidas entre otras cosas y también para darle una mejora al terreno que muestra la fotografía donde siembra sus semillas y así pueda tener mejores cosechas  para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia, 40, makes a living farming. She sows corn and loroco (a vine with edible flowers). With the earnings to makes she manages to cover the home expenses. 

She lives with her husband and 4 children, 18, 16, 14, and 5 years old. 

She is requesting this loan which will allow her to buy what is necessary for her crops such as: manure, fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and other things. It is also to improve the land where she sows her seeds which she is showing in the photograph. 

This way she can have better harvests, have more income, and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and improve the land.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É técnica de recursos humanos e criadora de frangos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, e outros) para aumentar a sua produção de frangos. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e ser conhecida como uma grande avicultora, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar o número de capoeiras para criar poedeiras e obter mais rendimento para realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Inocencia is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a human resources technician and she raises chickens. With the current loan she intends to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business and become known as a great poultry farmer. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is increasing the number of coops in order to raise laying hens. Another challenge is earning more profits so that she can accomplish all her projects.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.

loans.name: Yessenia Josefina

texts.es:
Yessenia ,33 años de edad  es una humilde comerciante habitante de la ciudad de Granada, madre de tres hijos. Ella se dedica a vender ropa, este negocio lo empezó hace 10 años cuando viajaba a Panamá a comprar ropa y vender en Granada vendía al crédito y al contado de manera ambulante todos los días. Hasta que logro alquilar un local donde vende ropa aunque aún así no deja de vender ambulante, también en ocasiones vende pollos para ayudarse a conseguir otras formas de ingreso. 
El financiamiento que está solicitando lo usara para comprar  ropa para damas y caballeros, artesanías y cosméticos. Pues desea ofrecer variedad a su clientela y a la vez diversificar su negocio, desea que cada día se más estable y genero buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 33, is a modest merchant who lives in the city of Granada and is the mother of three children. She sells clothing, a business she started 10 years ago on traveling to Panama to buy clothes to sell in Granada. She sold for credit and cash as a street vendor every day until she managed to rent a stall where she now offers her clothing. She sometimes sells chicken as well to earn more money.

She will use this loan to buy men's and women's clothing, handicrafts, and cosmetics. She wants to offer her customers more variety and diversify her business. She wants to see the business become stronger each day and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing, handicrafts, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.es: Ella es Adelita tiene 18 años esta estudiando enfermería vive con sus padres y sus hermanas su madre no trabaja porque sufre de una enfermedad muy grave, su padre ha trabajado toda la vida para que no les falte nada ella se graduó el año pasado y pensaba que no iba a seguir estudiando pero gracias a Dios y a su padre pudo iniciar una carrera técnica laboral en enfermería aunque ha sido un gran esfuerzo poder pagar, siempre se ha destacado por ser muy buena estudiante, Lo que mas desea en este momento es salir adelante y en un futuro ayudar al hombre que ha dado todo por ella su papa, su madre es lo mas hermoso de su vida ella siempre la apoya y la ayuda moralmente, ella quiere ser una gran enfermera y tener un buen trabajo, vivir cómodamente, ayudarle a sus padres y que ellos se sientan orgullosos de ella.
texts.en:
Adelita, 18, studies nursing.  She lives with her parents and her sisters.  Her mother does not work because she suffers from a serious illness.  Her father has worked all of his life so that his family always had what they needed.  

Adelita graduated last year and thought that she was not going to be able to continue her studies, however thanks to God and her father she was able to start a nursing degree.  Although it has been difficult to pay, she has been a great student.  More than anything she hopes to be successful in the future to be able to help the man who has given her so much, her father.  Her mother is wonderful, and she has always supported and helped her. 

Adelita hopes to be a great nurse, have a good job, live comfortably, and help her parents so that they feel proud of her.

loans.use: to continue studying to be a nurse

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 6 filhos todos maiores, vive na casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela.
É comerciante vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, areia, pedra, e outros) para construir um aviário. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e ser conhecida como uma grande avicultora, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e economizar para pagar devidamente o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Olinda is single and has six children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a house that she owns and also supports her mother who lives with her.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, sand, rocks, etc.) in order to build an aviary.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business and become known as a great poultry farmer. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder so that she can repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, sand, rocks, etc.) in order to build an aviary.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael tiene 28 años de edad es un hombre muy hogareño y responsable, vive en la casa de sus padres acompañado de su esposa, su hijo y sus padres.Desde muy chico fue inculcado en el mundo de la carpintería, gracias a que su padre desempeñaba en ese negocio . Fue desde ahí que Michael se dedica a la carpintería,  y desde entonces mantiene a su familia gracias a su trabajo, con la experiencia de su padre y el apoyo de toda su familia, decidieron abrir un local en su hogar colocando a la venta lo que fabrica.El principal problema en este trabajo es el material requerido, tanto por su escasez como por el precio de la madera. Pero gracias a la responsabilidad y la buena referencia de ser un buen cliente ah podido salir a delante junto a su familia.Como carpintero espera seguir mejorando su trabajo para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor producto.Para Michael este es el primer crédito de Kiva y esta muy agradecido por el apoyo económico que recibe , razón por la cual se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
El dinero solicitado de S/.3000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de listones de madera ya que es el producto principal de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Michael is 28 years old, very responsible, and dedicated to home and family. He lives in his parents' house with his wife, son, and parents. Since Michael was a small boy, he has been inculcated in the world of carpentry, thanks to his Father's dedication to the business. That's how Michael became attached to carpentry; and from that time forward, he has supported his family, thanks to his work. With his Father's experience and the help of all his family, he decided to open a shop in his home, selling whatever he makes.

The main problem in this work is obtaining the necessary material, due to scarcity and the price of wood. But thanks to Michael's responsibility and good references as a good client, he has been able to advance with his family. As a carpenter, he hopes to continue improving his work and to be able to offer better services to his customers and a better product. 

For Michael, this is his 1st loan with Kiva and he will be very grateful for all the economic help he receives. For that reason, he is committed to being punctual in meeting his scheduled payments. Michael is requesting 3,000 sols to invest in the purchase of wooden planks, since this is the principal material with which he works.

loans.use: buy wood for his woodworking shop.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Don Salvador es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos es muy trabajador, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra los principales granos básicos, maíz, frijol y maicillo cuando ya esta su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego salir a comercilaizarlos. Don Salvador desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Salvador is a man who is very responsible with his home obligations.  He has always been characterized as someone who offers the best to his children.  Presently, he lives with his wife and their five children.  He is hardworking and makes a living as a farmer, growing bulk grains, corn, beans, and sorghum.  After he harvests his crops he stores them in the silos (pictured) until they are purchased.  

Salvador hopes to increase his sales; for this reason, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy: seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and other items.  He hopes to receive this help since he does not have other means of monetary income.  With this, he will be able to continue providing food for his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol cuando ya esta lista la cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego comercializarla en agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para poder comparar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
This borrower has earned his living in agriculture for four years. His main crops are corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the grain silos that appear in the photograph and later sells it to grain brokers that are near his place of residence. With the profits that he earns from his sales, he contributes to the expenses that his family has; he lives with his family. 

The borrower is requesting a loan so that he can purchase the agricultural supplies that will help him to grow his crops: soil amendments, seeds, and fertilizers. That way, he will be able to have better earnings and continue helping with household costs with no limitations.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a 34 year old woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has a retail water container refilling business.  For four years this has been the source of her income. 

Dulce is asking for a loan to buy more gallons for water. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and her income. In the future, Dulce hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more gallons for water.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 2 años, su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol cuando sus cultivos ya estan listos los almacena en el granero que muestra la fotografia y luego los comercializa  en agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa de sus padres,con sus hermanos los cuales le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura, el esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: The client has worked in agriculture for 2 years, his main crops being corn and beans.  When his crops are ripe, he stores them in the barn shown in the photo and then sells them in basic grain trading agencies close to his home.  He uses his earnings from his sales to help with the family expenses, as he lives in his parents' house, along with his siblings, who help with the farming.  He is applying for a loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure, seeds and fertiliser, to help him grow his crops and to boost his earnings and enable him to contribute fully to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Moises Armando

texts.es: moises de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Durante 20 años ha trabajado en la agricultura, que aprendió de su padre, las cosechas que recoge las comercializa en las agencias de garnos basicos y con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar, El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar abonos, semillas, pesticidas y herbicidas, entre otras cosas. Así poder obtener los ingresos para mantener a su familia y darle una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Moises, 39 years old, lives with his wife in their own home. For 20 years he has worked in agriculture, which he learned from his father. He sells his harvests to basic grain storehouses, and with his earnings he is able to cover his home expenses and other necessities that may arise. The loan that he is asking for is to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and herbicides, among other materials. This way, he will be able to continue earning the income needed to maintain his family and their economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
