texts.es: la clienta vive con su hermano y su papa en casa propia, tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 2 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de su residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que hay su casa, la clienta solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, carne para hamburguesas, entre otros ingredientes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
The client lives with her brother and father in a house they own. For two years, she has owned a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers and today, she has many customers because she sells her food at a good price. Her business is close to the house and she uses her earnings to help with household expenses. 

The client is requesting a loan to buy the products she needs to make her sandwiches and hamburgers, including bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadella, hamburger meat, and other ingredients, in order to increase her earnings and continue helping out with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy products to make sandwiches and hamburgers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años y eso le ha dado la capasidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol cuando ya esta lista su cosecha la va almacenando en los graneros que mustra en la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos  en agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos y mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganacias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
The client has been farming for eight years.  This has given him the ability and the knowledge that is needed to take care of his crops.  His main crops are corn and beans.  

When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries that are shown in the photograph.  He later sells them at agencies that buy and sell basic grains.  He also sells them at markets that are close to where he lives.  The income that he gets from his sales helps with the family expenses.  He lives in his own house with his family.

The client is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies that will help him sow his crops.  He will buy things like manure, seeds, and fertilizers.  This way he will be able to have better income, and he will continue helping with the household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: don salvador de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y el maicillo cuando esta lista su cosecha la almacena en lo graneros que muestra en la fotografia y luego sale a venderlas a los comercios de granos basicos cerca de donde reside con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposa logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, el solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas y foliares y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador, 43, lives with his wife and their two children in their own house. He has made a living in agriculture for several years. 

His main crops are corn and sorghum. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the silos which are shown in the photo. Later, he goes out to sell the crops to merchants of staple grains, close to where he lives. With these sales and with the help of his wife, they manage to cover the home expenses. 

He has applied for a loan which will allow him to buy manure, pesticide, herbicide, and plant fertilizers. He will be able to continue with his harvests in order to achieve better earnings and a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticide, herbicide, and plant fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su familia en casa propia cuando pasa la temporada agricola el cliente se dedica a trabajar de pintar casas y  poner cielos falsos , el cliente esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y darle una mejora al terreno donde cultiva sus cosechas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias ya que con lo que vende y le pangan no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
The borrower has been involved in agriculture for five years and grows mainly corn and beans.  He sells his crops to the basic grain dealers located near his place of residence.  With the profits he earns from sales he helps cover family expenses.  He lives with his family in his own home.  When farm season is over, the borrower works painting houses or installing drywall.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies to help with his cultivating activity, such as fertilizers and seeds, so he can improve the cropland to earn more income.  What he sells now is not enough to cover these expenses, so the loan will help him continue covering household expenses without limitation.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Siira

texts.en:
Siira is a 45 year old married man with four children, living in Kasese,Uganda.  For fifteen years he has been selling timber and this has enabled him to provide for his growing family. 

Siira says that had he had enough money, he would buy more land and plant more trees to secure his future and also not let his activities have a negative impact upon the environment.  Siira intends to use the loan to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with two school going children. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mercy has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years.  She sells from home to her neighbors.  Mercy dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años ella siembra maiz y frijol vive en casa propia con su hija, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos de los gastos de su casa, la clienta solicita un credito para poder comprar insumos que necesita para su cosecha como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, y tambien para darle una mejora al terreno donde siembra como muestra en la fotografia para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su hija una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
The client has made a living in agriculture growing corn and beans for several years.  She lives in her own house with her daughter.  With her profits she's able to cover some of her household expenses.

She's requesting a loan to be able to buy the supplies she needs for her harvest: seeds, fertilizer, and soil amendments.  She also wants to improve the plot of land where she plants, as seen in the photograph, so she can earn more profits and give her daughter better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve her plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic ingredients for her fod business

loans.name: Ford Adade

texts.en:
Ford Adade is a petty trader and he also sells provisions at Akpafu, Hohoe Township.  He has received education to junior high school.  Ford Adade is married and has one child.  His wife is also a petty trader. 

Ford Adade has been selling provisions for seven years.  He is responsible for the general up keep of the home and he supports his mother. 

His loan will be used to buy cartons of tin tomatoes, Milo, Nido, candies.  He hopes to use the profits from his expanded business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: to buy cartons of tin tomatoes, Milo, Nido, candies.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 48 years old. She is married with six children and they all go to school. 

With the loan, Speciose wants to buy more peanuts, tomatoes and flour to resell. 

With the profits she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, tomatoes and flour to resell.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, óleo, peixe, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja trabalhar mais e fazer crescer o seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é economizar mais para garantir o pagamento do empréstimo.
texts.en:
Adelaide is a widow and has four children who attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (rice, flour, cooking oil, fish, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to work harder and expand her business. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is saving more money to ensure that the loan will be repaid.

loans.use: to purchase goods (rice, flour, cooking oil, fish, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 26 years old. She sells utensils and has been in the business for six year.  Her husband is a businessman. 

With her loan, Chantal will buy more utensils to sell.

The profits will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna earns a living by selling cosmetics and other personal care products to the people where she lives. 

She is a married woman and a mother of one child.  

Johna is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like lotion, perfume, cosmetics and others.  

She hoped the loans will enable her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like lotion, perfume, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Odille

texts.en:
Odille is 27 years old.  She has sold various items in her boutique for six years. 

Odille has requested the loan to buy more lotions, salt, and eggs for resale. 

The profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more lotions, salt, and eggs for resale.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris, tiene la edad de 38 años, es casada pero no vive con su esposo, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere  comprar abono e insumos  para asistir  siembra de café que tiene en su finca.  Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer en producción y en lo económico. también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Iris is 38 years old and married, but she does not live with her husband.  She has two children who are her highest priority.  Iris wants to buy compost and supplies so that she can maintain the coffee crops on her farm.  She has been farming for several years and wants to grow her production and her finances.  In addition, she wants to see her farm become more productive.  

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  Iris does not have any other loans with the state banks or the cooperatives.  FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.  

Iris also wants to provide her children with the necessary education so that they will be prepared individuals in the future and have a much easier life.

loans.use: to buy compost and farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente  vive en Guayaquil. El cliente empezó trabajando como taxista, luego ingreso a trabajar a un lugar donde hace arreglos metalicos para la empresa, donde con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar un vehículo y en los tiempos libres se dedica a ser taxiar para tener mas ingresos.

La dificultades que él tiene es el dolor en le hombros ya que tiene discapacidad porque hace tiempo atras tuvo un accidente que lo dejo con su discapacidad. No está casado ni tiene hijos. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar accesorios, herramientas para el carro etc.  Su sueño es tener una casa propia donde pueda vivir junto a sus seres queridos, tener una cadena de taxis para darles trabajo a mis amigos.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil.  He started out working as a taxi driver, but later he got a job at a place that repairs metallic structures for businesses.  Through great effort, he was able to buy a vehicle and now he works a taxi driver in his spare time in order to earn more income.  

The difficulty he faces is the pain in his shoulders that resulted from an accident he suffered some time ago that left him disabled.  He is not married and has no children.   

With this loan, the borrower will buy accessories and equipment for his car and other items.  His dream is to have a house of his own where he can live with his loved ones.  He also wants to have a fleet of taxis so that he can provide jobs for his friends.

loans.use: to buy accessories and equipment for his car

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José  tiene 43 años de edad, es divorciado y vive con los padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de mariscos. El quiere iniciar con este proyecto  con la intención  de distribuirlos a diferentes partes de la zona y con ello aumentar un poco las ventas y los ingresos y así poder ayudar a sus padres. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, divorced and lives with with his parents.  

He needs this loan to buy seafood.  He wants to start this project with the intention of distributing it to different parts of his area.  With this, he would like to increase his sales a bit and thus be able to help his parents.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Maritzabel

texts.es: Maritzabel, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está casada  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar abonos y fumigaciones para asistir una plantación de café. Ella tiene pensado obtener una buena producción  con ello mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia,  para obtener buenas ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maritzabel is 27 years old and married.  She would like to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and fumigants to help with a coffee crop.  She hopes to obtain good production and with that more income to help her family, to earn more profits, have a better quality of life, and a stable financial situation.  

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better facilities and lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a coffee nursery.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma irmã que vive com ela.
É comerciante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (roupas, cosméticos, brincos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja trabalhar mais e abrir uma empresa de catering, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é economizar mais fundos e conseguir um bom espaço para o seu novo investimento.
texts.en:
Rosalina is single and has two children who attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and also supports a sister who lives with her.
She's a merchant who sells various products. With the current loan she intends to purchase products (clothing, cosmetics, earrings, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to work harder and open a catering business. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is saving more money and finding a good space for her new investment.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, cosmetics, earrings, etc., in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa da empresa e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É cozinheira numa empresa e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, ferro, e pagar a mão de obra) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a casa e mobilar para melhor acomodar os seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e iniciar um negocio em casa para aumentar o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Ines is single and has two children who attend school. She lives in a house provided by company housing and doesn't support anyone else.
She works as a cook for a company. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, iron) and pay for labor in order to continue building her house.
Her wish for the future is to finish building and furnishing her house so that her children will be more comfortable. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder and starting a business from home in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, iron) and pay for labor in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with four children. She has received schooling but only to the middle school level. 

Beatrice sells smoked and dry fish in the Akpafu, Hohoe community, which she has done since 2005 when she realized she need to do something to support her family.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Beatrice will use the loan to purchase different types of fish to resell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to save and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase different types of fish to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 54 year old married woman.  She has five children ranging in age between 12 and 32.  She describes herself to be hardworking. 

Mary operates a farm where she grows peas and potatoes trading.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are traders.  She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy seeds for peas and potatoes. Her business goal is to succeed within five years.

loans.use: to buy seeds for peas and potatoes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a farmer from Getafe, Bohol.  She is a married woman and a mother of seven children. 

She has been engaged in farming business for more than 20 years now.  This is their main source of income.

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.  With the loan she hopes to improve her farm and eventually her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is 57 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar and cooking oil for resale.  The profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Hasani

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school.  He owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for over ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.  He faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators. 

With the loan, Hassan wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente  vive en Guayaquil. Empezó hace barios años con la venta de zapatos y después  empezó a vender ropa de marca y a los clientes le gusta la mercadería que vendia por eso comenzo a tener una cartera de clientes. 

Su negocio es una boutique donde tiene blusas, pantalones, zapatos para vender. Su dificultad es cuando tiene recaídas no puede laborar normalmente y se queda en casa, ya que ella es Pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida). No está casada, ni tiene hijos. En la foto tiene apariencia de mujer porque es transexual. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar zapatos, ropa de mujer. Su  sueño es formar una familia disfrutar juntos con ellos, tener una casa propia, tener un local en un centro comercial y dar trabajo a personas con la misma situación.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil.  He started out several years ago selling shoes, but afterwards he began selling brand-name clothing to his customers who like the merchandise he sells.  For this reason, he has an established clientele.  

His business is a boutique where he sells blouses, trousers, and shoes.  The difficulties he must deal with include relapses that prevent him from working normally, so he must stay at home.  The borrower is a patient who is living with HIV/AIDS.  He is not married and has no children.  The borrower appears to be a women because he is a transsexual.


With this loan, the borrower will buy shoes and clothing for women.  His dream is start a family and enjoy being with them.  He would also like to have a house of his own and a store at a shopping center so that he can provide jobs to people who are in the same situation.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, iron, rocks, bricks, etc.) in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her child and buy assorted cereals for sale.

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en:
Xaverine is 48 years old. She sells various items and has been in business for fifteen years. 

With the loan, Xaverine wants to buy more rice, mineral water and bananas for resale. 

The profits will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, mineral water and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol.  He has been in business for more than four years.  This is the source of his income. 

Marvin is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat.  

With the loan he will be able to improve his catch, sell more fish and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat.

loans.name: Eleodoro  Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 23m años de edad es soltero   vive con la familia en el Cantón Chimbo  Provincia Bolívar.

Alejandro se dedica a la sastrería. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar electrodomésticos como la refrigeradora. 

 Las compras lo realizan en  la ciudad de Guaranda. 
 
Su seño es mejorar el nivel de vida.   No tiene ningún desafío que enfrentar. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 23 years old.  He is single and living with his family in the Chimbo canton of the Bolívar province.

Alejandro makes a living as a tailor.  He is applying for this loan to buy electrical appliances, such as a fridge.  

He will buy the items in Guaranda.

Alejandro's dream is to improve his living standards.  He is facing no particular challenges at the moment.

In his free time he likes to play football.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances, such as a fridge.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus Cruz

texts.es:
Carmen  de  Jesús tiene 46 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos vive con su esposo  e hijos en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.

Carmen de Jesús se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, insecticidas y demás productos para la siembra.  
La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chimbo. 

Su sueño es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo.

El desafío que enfrenta es la competencia.   
En el tiempo libre  le gusta compartir en familia.
texts.en:
35901

Carmen de Jesús, 46, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in Chimbo Canton, Bolívar Province.  Carmen de Jesús makes a living in agriculture growing corn.

She's requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and other supplies for the planting.  She makes her purchases in the city of Chimbo.

Her dream is to have enough working capital.  The challenge she faces is competition.  She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María tiene 65 años de edad es viuda    vive con su familia en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.
María es jubilada. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar viveres y una licuadora. Las compras lo  realizan en el Cantón Chimbo.   

Su sueño es seguir mejorando la calidad de vida.

El desafío que enfrenta  luchar contra cualquier problema que se presente.

En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse con la familia
texts.en:
María is 65 years old and a widow. She lives with her family in Chimbo Canton, in Bolívar Province. María is retired. She is requesting a loan to improve her store supplies and to buy a blender. She will make her purchases in Chimbo Canton. Her dream is to continue improving her quality of life. She faces the challenge of fighting against any problem that presents itself.

She likes to spend her spare time with her family.

loans.use: to improve her store supplies and to buy a blender

loans.name: Gustavo Napoleon

texts.es:
Gustavo  tiene 25 años de edad es soltero vive con la familia en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar. 

Gustavo se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y trigo. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, ureas, abonos y demás productos necesarios para la siembra y poder adelantar el trabajo. 

Las compras lo realizan  en  la ciudad de Guaranda. 

 Su sueño es  mejorar el nivel de vida de toda la familia.

 El desafío que enfrenta es  precio muy bajo en el mercado y el cambio de clima.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte como el futbol
texts.en:
Gustavo is 25 years old, single, and lives with his family in the canton of Chimbo, which is in Bolívar Province.  He is a farmer who grows corn and wheat.  

Gustavo is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies, urea, compost, and other needed products for his crops so that he can proceed with his work.  His purchases are made in the city of Guaranda.  His dream is to improve the standard of living for his entire family.  The challenges he faces include the very low prices offered at the market and the changes in the weather.  

In his free time, Gustavo enjoys playing sports such as soccer.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, urea, compost, and other needed items.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor  tiene 33 años de edad es soltero vive con sus padres  en el cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar. 

Víctor  es chofer profesional.

Solicita el  préstamo para adquirir lo que le hace falta  en la casa como lavadora y comida que no se dañe

Les adquiere en Chimbo cada mes.

Su sueño es tener lo básico para  realizar su trabajo. 

El desafío que  enfrenta es  la competencia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir con su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 33 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Chimbo, which is in Bolívar Province.  He is a professional chauffeur.  

Victor is requesting a loan so that he can acquire what he is lacking for example a washer and non-perishable food.  He makes his purchases in Chimbo every month.  His dream is to have basic necessities so that he can perform his job.  The challenge he faces is dealing with the competition.  

In his free time, he enjoys sharing with his family.

loans.use: to acquire what he is lacking for example a washer and non-perishable food

loans.name: Dario Javier

texts.es:
Darío tiene 21 años de edad es soltero vive con la familia en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.



Darío se dedica a la venta de chanchos.


solicita el crédito para invertir en chanchos y comida para ellos como balanceado.


Las compras lo realiza en el Cantón Chimbo.


 Su sueño es de culminar la universidad. 


El desafío que enfrenta es la Salud.    


En su tiempo libre le gusta  trabajar y estudiar.
texts.en:
Dario, 21, is single and lives with his family in Chimbo Canton, Bolivar Province. Dario works selling pigs. He is asking for the loan to invest in his pigs and buy them food.  He will make his purchases in Chimbo Canton. 

His dream is to finish university. The challenge he faces is health. In his free time, he likes to work and study.

loans.use: to invest in his pigs and buy them food

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 35 years old.  She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for three years. 

Marie has requested a loan to buy potatoes and beans for resale.  The profits will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and beans for resale.

loans.name: Francisco  De Jesus

texts.es: Don Francisco de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad el se dedica a la crianza de pollo de engorde desde hace 5 años tiene mucha clientela pues los da a precios accesibles, con las ventas que realiza de sus pollos logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Francisco esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar concentrado para sus pollos y vitaminas y asi el pueda tener mejores ganancias con sus ventas y pueda darle una mejor estabilidad economica a su familia
texts.en: Francisco is 60 years old. He lives in his own house with his two children who are 14 and 12 years old. He has been working breeding chickens to fatten for five years. He has many customers as he gives them good prices. With the sales he makes from his chickens he can pay the household expenses. Francisco is asking for a loan in order to buy feed for his chickens and vitamins so he can have better earnings from his sales and offer better financial stability to his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his chickens

loans.name: Winston Alberto

texts.es: Winston, de 42 años de edad, casado, padre 2 hijos, originario de la ciudad de León, él se dedica a fabricar muebles desde. Este negocio lo empezó cuando tenía 24 años de edad, pues fue el único oficio que aprendió y su idea de poner una carpintería fue con la esperanza de dejarles un patrimonio a sus dos hijas. Actualmente solo tiene un ayudante al cual el paga semanal. Hacer puertas, roperos, sillas, mesas, estantes, gabinetes etc. Él está solicitando el crédito para comprar un router para hacer molduras en maderas. Pues su idea es poder variedad de muebles con una presentación más fina, darse a conocer es ferias y eventos que promuevan el talento de los artesanos nacionales que fabrican muebles de muy buena calidad. Su meta es lograr ampliar con mejor maquinaria su taller de carpintería y poder dar empleos a más personas.
texts.en: Winston is 42 years old, married, and the father of 2 children. He is from the city of León. He makes furniture. He started this business when he was 24 years old. It was the only trade he learned and his idea was to open a carpentry shop in the hope of leaving his two daughters an inheritance. Right now, he only has one assistant whom he pays weekly. He makes doors, wardrobes, chairs, shelves, cabinets, etc. He is asking for the loan to buy a router to make wooden frames. His idea is to have a variety of furniture with better presentation, and become known at fairs and events that make high quality furniture. His goal is to be able to expand his carpentry shop with better machinery and be able to give jobs to more people.

loans.use: to buy a router to make wooden frames.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
Bahodur is married and has 2 children. He has always wanted to provide a good quality of life for his children. For this reason, he began his own business with driving three years ago. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he has had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. Also, their the financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. 
He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Amariles Melania

texts.es:
Amariles tiene 25 años de edad   es soltero vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.


Amariles se dedica  al negocio de animales. 


Solicita el crédito para  la  compra de animales pollos y cerdos y poder aumentar el negocio. 


Y las compras lo realizan en la Ciudad de Chillanes.  





Su sueño es tener una vivienda propia. 




El desafío que enfrenta es el capital. 



En el tiempo libre le gusta leer.
texts.en: Amariles is 25 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar.  Amariles has a business dedicated to animals.  She is requesting this loan to purchase animals and be able to expand her business.  She makes her purchases in the city of Chillanes.  Her dream is to have her own home.  The challenge she faces is a lack of capital.  In her free time, she likes to read.

loans.use: to purchase animals and to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Eucevio  Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene45 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos vive con vive con una amiga en el  Cantón Chillanes 

Provincia Bolívar.




Es integrante de ventanilla Unión Central Parroquia San José del  Tambo actividad económica agricultura, 

crianza de animales  y comercio la comunidad se encuentra a una hora de la cooperativa.




Clemente se dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de cacao. 



Solicita el crédito para dar mantenimiento a las huertas de cacao, café y plátano.  



Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de mata de cacao.  



Su sueño es tener un negocio propio y un vehículo. 



No tiene ningún desafío que enfrentar.  



En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Clemente, 45, is single and has two children.  He lives with a friend in Chillanes Canton in Bolívar Province.

He's a member of Unión Central Communal Bank in the parish of San José del Tambo, where the economic activities are agriculture, raising animals, and trade. The community is located an hour from the cooperative.

Clemente makes a living in agriculture, such as growing cacao.  He's requesting the loan to take care of his cacao, coffee, and banana fields.  He makes his purchases in the city of Mata de Cacao.

His dream is to have his own business and a vehicle. He faces no challenges. In his free time he likes to play sports and listen to music.

loans.use: to take care of his cacao, coffee, and banana fields

loans.name: Olga Marieta

texts.es:
Olga tiene 42 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo  vive con el hijo en el Cantón Chillanes   Provincia 

Bolívar.




Es integrante de ventanilla Unión Central Parroquia San José del  Tambo actividad económica agricultura,

crianza de animales  y comercio la comunidad se encuentra a una hora de la cooperativa.



 Olga se dedica a la crianza de animales como las aves. 



Solicita el crédito para la crianza de pollos y así poder aumentar la crianza de aves.   



Las compras lo realizan en la  Ciudad de San José del Tambo.  



Su sueño  es tener un negocio propio.  No tiene ningún  desafío que enfrentar.  

En el tiempo libre le gusta ir al sur y jugar.
texts.en:
Olga is 42 years old. She is single and has one child. They live in the Chillanes Canton, in the Bolivar province. She is a member of the communal bank "Union Central Parroquia San Jose del Tambo", which focuses on animal breeding, agricultural and commercial activities. The community is located one hour away from the communal bank.
Olga raises poultry. She is asking for this loan to raise chicken and increase poultry raising.
She carries out her shopping in the city of San Jose del Tambo. Her dream is to have her own business. She faces no particular challenges.
In her spare time she likes to go to the south and play.

loans.use: to raise chicken and increase increase poultry raising

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Salomón tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cinco hijos. Desde hace unos 30 años comercializa especies marinas; actividad que aprendió junto a familiares y amigos. Los mariscos como cancrejos, pescado, punches y camarones los compra a amigos y familiares que se dedican a la pesca, en la playa cuando desembargan sus lanchas y para venderlo Salomón se desplaza en su vehículo a distintas comunidades a venderlo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mayor cantidad de mariscos, ya que se acerca la época invernal y el número de mariscos incrementa. Con el préstamo, pretende cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene y satisfacer a sus clientes con lo que ellos necesitan. Con las ganancias, él desea reparar su vivienda, ya que esta en muy malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Salomón, who is 55, is married with five children.  He has been selling seafood for around 30 years, having learned his trade with family members and friends.  He buys his seafood like crabs, fish, punche [a type of crab] and shrimp, from friends and family members on the beach who spend the day fishing. When they dock their boats they sell their product to Salomon who then sells the seafood to different communities. 

He is applying to Fundación Campo for this loan to buy larger quantities of seafood, as winter is approaching and the amount of seafood is rising.  He is convinced that the loan will enable him to meet all his orders and satisfy all his customers' needs.  He intends to use his earnings to repair his home because it is in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of seafood, as winter is approaching and the amount of seafood is rising.

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: Don Alberto un humilde señor,  de 53 años de edad, es cliente Kiva, de oficio carpintero. Su primer préstamo  le beneficio mucho pues logro  comprar toda la materia prima que necesitaba para la elaboración de sus muebles,  como pintura, barniz, pegamento, lija,  ya que antes no tenia mucho capital con que trabajar y el financiamiento llego cuando mas lo necesitaba, logro pagar satisfactoriamente. Siempre sigue con  su lucha por mantener estable su negocio, con mejores condiciones y a la vez que le genere mejores ganancias. Hoy necesita de su segundo financiamiento para comprar madera, lija, pegamento,pintura y barniz. Con el objetivo de satisfacer  las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Alberto is a humble man of 53. He is a Kiva client and works as a carpenter. His first loan was a great help to him, as he was able to buy all the raw materials he needed for his furniture, including paint, varnish, glue, and sandpaper. In the past he did not have many economic resources to work with, and the loan arrived just when he needed it most. He was able to pay off his loan with no problems. He continues to work hard to keep his business going and increase his income. Today he needs a second loan to buy wood, sandpaper, glue, paint, and varnish. He hopes to be able to meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy wood, sandpaper, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Elba Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Elba es una señora que trabaja en el mercado de la ciudad de Estelí  desde hace 15 años con un pequeño puesto de comida con el cual con mucho esfuerzo pudo preparar a sus hijos ella tuvo tres hijos actualmente todos son adultos ella solamente mantiene a su mamá que ya está ancianita  doña Elba canceló su primer crédito  ella como madre soltera es una mujer emprendedora que todos respetan en su ambiente de trabajo la llaman Elbita el uso que le dio al crédito anterior fue prácticamente la compra de arroz frijoles carnes gallinas para sus famosas sopas , leña, maíz ella explica que al recibir su primer crédito le ayudó muchísimo por que pudo aumentar sus ventas y ahora hace más comida a pesar de las precios que han incrementado y de la gran competencia ella sigue adelante  sus sueños es ampliar su negocio poner más mesas y tener un lugar que sea agradable para sus clientes y para su familia. 


Doña Elba está solicitando el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, especies, carne , leña, mesas y sillas para su comedor,  maíz para tortillas .
texts.en:
Elba is a woman who has had a small food stall in the market in the city of Estelí for 15 years. With it, and with a lot of effort, she has been able to prepare her children. She had three children, who are now all adults. She supports only her mother, who is now very old. Elba paid off her first loan. As a single mother, she is an entrepreneurial woman whom everyone respects. In her work environment, they call her Elbita. She used the previous loan to buy rice, beans, meat, chickens for her famous soups, firewood, and corn. She explains that receiving the first loan helped her a lot because she was able to increase her sales and now she makes more food. Despite increased prices and a lot of competition, she continues moving forward. Her dreams are to expand her business, put in more tables, and have a place that is pleasant for her customers and for her family. 

Elba is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, spices, meat, firewood, tables and chairs for her dining room, and corn for tortillas.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, spices, meat, firewood, tables and chairs for her dining room, and corn for tortillas

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Don Viviano tiene 53  años de edad tiene 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad  actualmente tiene una zapatería llamada calzado Dalila tiene 25 años de tener su negocio, el ha trabajado ya cuatro créditos con fape y kiva  y gracias a su apoyo a crecido mas su negocio el esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertir  en material para fabricar nuevos estilos de zapatos para complacer  a sus clientes ya que para el lo mas importante es quedar bien con cada persona que visita su negocio por que gracias a su preferencia el a podido tener buenas ganancias y ha podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida  y sobre todo a crecido su negocio.esta muy agradecido con Dios y kiva que les ha ayudado a superarse a travez de los creditos.
texts.en: Viviano, 53, has 6 children who are all adults.  He has a shoe business called "Calzado Dalila."  He's had this business for 25 years, and he's already taken 4 loans with FAPE and KIVA.  Thanks to their support, he has been able to grow his business.  He is requesting a new loan to invest in supplies to make new styles of shoes to please his customers, because for him, the most important thing is to make a good impression with every person who visits his business.  Because his customers prefer his business, he's been able to have good earnings, improve his living conditions, and most importantly, grow his business.  Viviano is very grateful to God and to Kiva for helping him to succeed through these loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make shoes

loans.name: Yojaira Sixta

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Yohaira, quien en su confección compró una máquina plana y con ello ha agregado calidad a sus prendas de vestir además de haber logrado comprar materias prima e insumos en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos especiales. Hoy Yohaira ha mejorado la productividad y su negocio se encuentra muy fortalecido y con un gran potencial de crecimiento y sus ingresos se han incrementado también. Esta es la razón que la mantiene con muchos más sueños de prosperidad y está aplicando nuevamente a un creidikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará dos máquinas industriales, una de doble aguja y una recubridora, con esta inversión no solo aumentará, una vez más,  la calidad de sus prendas, sino sus tiempos productivos, lo cual es ganancia. Yohaira dice a sus financiadores de Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo: “Muchos  agradecimientos, espero volver a contar con sus préstamos para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support given to Yohaira, she was able to buy a stationery machine that helped to improve the quality of the garments she produces.  In addition, she was able to buy materials and supplies in large amounts so that she could receive special discounts.  

Today Yohaira has improved her productivity and her business is much stronger and has greater growth potential.  Her income has increased as well.  This is the reason why she has entertained many more dreams of becoming prosperous.  She is applying for another Kiva loan, her second form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, Yohaira will buy two industrial sewing machines, a double stitch machine and a cover stitch machine.  With this investment, not only will the quality of her clothing increase once again, but so will her productivity and her earnings.  

Yohaira says to the Kiva lenders and to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, “Many thanks.  I hope to return for more loans so that I can keep progressing.”

loans.use: to buy two industrial sewing machines.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de 46 años de edad, con muchas fuerzas, con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante y madre soltera de un hijo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo y agradece a DIOS y a sus padres por haberle dado la oportunidad de poder estudiar y tener un conocimiento básico. Fueron ellos en compañía de sus hermanos mayores en su juventud los que le enseñaron la actividad de la agricultura a muy temprana edad enseñándole las actividades como ser: corte, limpieza, fertilización y abono al cultivo. Este es el único medio de ingreso para su familia desde hace mucho tiempo y sigue siéndolo en la actualidad pudiendo cubrir necesidades como: la vestimenta, alimentación, medicinas entre otros. Sus clientes son las personas que llegan a la zona, vecinos, amigos y familiares que se dedican al comercio de este producto.  

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abono para su cultivo de café ya que hoy en día hay mucha plaga y enfermedades que deterioran los cultivos en su totalidad perdiendo todo de no tratar a tiempo. 

Su sueño es que su hijo logre educarse para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, un mejor futuro y puedan aprovechar las oportunidades que en un futuro se les presenten como también seguir aumentando su cultivo para obtener mejores ingresos ya que su familia solo depende de este rubro para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old. She is a very strong woman, and she is eager to improve herself and get ahead. She is a single mother and has one son. She completed her primary education and is grateful to God and to her parents for giving her the opportunity of going to school and acquiring basic knowledge. Her parents were the ones, along with her older siblings, who taught her the business of farming at a very young age. They taught her how to trim, clean, and fertilize the crops. This has been her family's only source of income for a long time. Currently that is still the case and they are able to cover their needs: clothing, food, medications, and other items. Her customers are the people who come to the area: neighbors, friends, and family members who work selling this product.

Currently she is requesting help to buy fertilizers and weed-killers for her coffee crops, since now days there are a lot of pests and diseases that deteriorate entire crops and everything can be lost unless treated in time. 

Her dream is for her son to be able to have an education so that he can have a higher quality of life, a better future, and make the most of the opportunities that may arise in the future. She also wants to continue increasing her crops in order to obtain a higher income, because her family depends on this business to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and weed-killers for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza es una mujer en una relación (en unión libre) que de su matrimonio tiene una hija la cual es menor de edad con apenas 4 años, junto a su pareja trabajan en la agricultura especialmente en el cultivo y siembra de café, actividad que realiza hace más de 3 años ya que desde pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la agricultura misma actividad que hasta hoy en día siguen ejerciendo sus padres, ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que los ingresos que sus padres obtenían eran muy pocos, actualmente su esposo y ella son apoyo mutuo para salir adelante del cual depende su única hija. El cultivo de café queda a una distancia de 3 kilómetros y medio al cual se trasladan para dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. Las tierras que en compañía de su pareja cultivan son propias gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres.

Maria Esperanza está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de fumigación para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya enfermedad que afecta especial mente esta clase de cultivo.
  
Ella sueña con educar a su hija para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y ella no quiere que su hija pase por la misma situación que ella paso en su juventud.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza is a woman in a free union relationship from which she has a daughter who is a minor, barely four years old. Along with her partner, she works in agriculture, especially in cultivating and planting coffee. She has been doing this work for more than three years, since it was her parents who taught her to work in agriculture when she was very young, and this is the same work that her parents still carry out. She hasn't had any level of education, since the income that her parents obtained was very little. Now she and her husband support each other to advance, and their only daughter depends on this. Their coffee planting  is three-and-a-half kilometers away, a distance that they must travel to maintain their coffee crop. The lands that she and her partner cultivate are their own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents.

Maria Esperanza is applying for help to buy fertilizer, compost, and spray pumps to maintain their coffee crop, since if they don't give it maintenance and care on time, it could be damaged by a rust disease that especially affects this type of crop.

She dreams of educating her daughter so that she can have a better quality of life and better opportunities for employment, since working the land is very hard and she doesn't want her daughter to go through the same situation that she went through in her youth.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost and sprayer pumps to maintain her coffee planting

loans.name: Marelith

texts.es:
Marelith, de 35 años de edad,está casada con Hipólito quien es agricultor y con quien tiene 02 hijos de 16 y 06 años de edad respectivamente, vive junto a ellos en su casa propia la cual construyó  con el apoyo de su esposo.El trabajo de Marelith, consiste en le venta de plátanos y frutas al por mayor y menor ya que tiene una chacra de 14 hectáreas en donde tiene todos los productos que pone a la venta, de manera continua realiza la cosecha programada de sus cultivos con ayuda de un obrero que contrata temporalmente y todo lo obtenido lo ofrece en su puesto que tiene en el mercado principal de la ciudad y en donde trabaja todo el día. Tiene su puesto desde hace 05 años pero desarrolla este oficio desde muy joven, se inició ayudando en otros puestos, ahora tiene su propio establecimiento y ahí trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo mayor quienes la apoyan en la carga y el transporte de la pesada mercadería. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico más para su familia, se siente cómoda con su labor ya que conoce muy bien el ritmo del trabajo, comenta que tiene muchas ganas de seguir ampliando su negocio es por eso que ahora desea complementarlo con la venta de algunas verduras que son más solicitadas por el público.Este es el crédito número 06 con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo .
El préstamo solicitado de 3800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su terreno y la producción de Frutas regionales que es su principal producto de negocio, pero tambien comprará verduras como cebollas, papa y tomate.
texts.en:
Marelith is 35 years old and married to a man named Hipolito who is a farmer. They have two children who are 16 and six years old and she lives with them in her own home which she built with the help of her husband. Marelith's work consists of selling plantains and fruits at wholesale and retail prices as she has 14 hectares of land where she grows the produce that she sells. She harvests the produce in a continuous manner with the support of a day laborer who she contracts seasonally. Everything she gets from the harvest is sold at her stall located in the main market of the city where she works all day. She has had her stall for five years but has been working in this field since she was very young. She began initially by helping out at other stalls but now has her own establishment where she works with the support of her husband and older son. They assist her in loading and transporting the heavy produce. 

What she likes about her work is that it allows her to have a greater income source for her family. She feels comfortable with her work because she is very familiar with the rhythm of the business. She says that she has a great desire to continue expanding her business. It is for this reason that she hopes to complement her business with the sale of vegetables that are in high demand from the public. This is her sixth Kiva loan. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support to be able to continue increasing her working capital. 

The loan she has requested is 3800 nuevos soles which she will invest in the maintenance of her land and the production of regional fruits which are her business' primary products, and will also buy vegetables including onion, potatoes and tomato.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her land and buy vegetables.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
A wonderful woman by the name of Bahriniso lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who has a very small salary. They have 3 clever children. Some years ago her son was ill and she went to Russia for his treatment. When her son became healthy, she returned to Tajikistan and began her own business, a taxi service. Now her business is going well and she manages the business perfectly. She wants to improve her living condition. She plans to repair her house, as it is old and is in bad condition. She wants to change the windows and to repair all the rooms. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to repair her house. 

In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house, which is in bad condition

loans.name: Rogaciana

texts.en: Rogaciana is a 43-year-old married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of her income. Rogaciana is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise, and feed. In the future, Rogaciana hopes to use her loan to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, and feed

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. His wife is a housewife, and she supports him in taking care of the kids. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Juma has operated a coconut-selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. In addition, he also sells farm products which is another source of livelihood.

With this loan, he wants to purchase 10 sacks of coconuts and pay for labour for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of coconuts and pay for labour for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man who has been selling clothes for ten years. He is well known in his region because of his competitive prices and the good quality of the products he is providing.

Ahmad is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business clothes with a special released spring and summer collection. He is working hard to expand his business and increase his income to make a small beautiful family of his own. He wants to provide them with the best education, which he is sorry that he didn't have the chance to experience. Ahmad is working hard to move his shop to a wider shop to attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase his business clothes with a special released spring and summer collection

loans.name: Ann Maa Tarini Self Help Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali, 36, is married and lives with her family in the village of Balipatna in the Khurda district. She has two children, who are in school. To make a living, she has been farming vegetables on one acre of farmland for four years. The current business earns her family about 5,000 Indian rupees per month.

Gitanjali's group consists of twelve members who live in the same village and are neighbors. All the group members are engaged in vegetable and paddy farming. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and also use a portion of it to spend on labor costs for pumping water. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her field business so as to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Abert

texts.en:
Abert is a 23-year-old man. He is married and stays in Nongo Zone A with his wife. They have no child at the moment. He is a farmer who works in agriculture, specifically, banana growing. He also deals in cereals during the cereals season in the harvest period.

He has been in agriculture since 2006, and his main source of income is banana growing. He started this business in order to get money and earn a living. He has acquired this loan for buying more bananas (matooke) and to purchase coffee for trading. He usually sells his products to traders from his village. He hopes to enlarge his businesses as time goes on. But his biggest problem is traders who are not trustworthy--that is, those who take his agricultural products on credit and take a long time to settle their payments.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and coffee

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 25-year-old single woman who works as a graphic designer and has specialized in drawing maps since 2011. She is a hard worker, working from her house because she still can't afford to have an office of her own. Salwa is developing her business with newly released technologies. That's why she is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy a laptop, printer, and scanner that will surely make her designs and thoughts clearer.

Most of Salwa's customers are engineers, whom she helps in finishing their map designs. She hopes to keep on developing her business in a well managed way, to keep on pleasing her customers and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a laptop, printer, and scanner necessary for her business

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Odsuren, 25 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. From 2005 to 2010, she studied economics at a Russian college and now works as a train washer at train station. Her husband has been working as a carpenter at foreign invested company since 2011. Her daugher goes to kindergarten while her son stays at home. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some repairs. So she is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as planks, cements, gypsum walls, fiberglass and foams. Using these materials, she can repair and insulate her house thus providing comfortable and warm accommodation for her family. As a result, the family will burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek is 28 years old and married with three children. Being a responsible father, Ulugbek works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs. He is an animal farmer and also has a farming business, growing onions and corn on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards, he works hard from early morning till late evening for two years on his land.

Ulugbek would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,300 USD to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds for the new planting season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta vive en Guayaquil. Empezó  vendiendo junto a su mamá comida en pascuales luego que se cambio de casa siguien con el negocio de comida y ahora vende en el Sur de la ciudad ya que a ella le gusta mucho cocinar, trabaja sola de 14h00 a 21h00.

La dificultad que ella tiene es cuando recae no puede trabajar ya que ella es pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida) y la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde ella tiene su negocio. 

Es soltera, tiene un hijo de 1 año, con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz mesas y sillas. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, para disfrutar junto a  su hijo y tener en su restaurante venta de cola.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. She stated out selling food with her mother in the neighborhood of Pascuales. She later moved to another house, but she continued her food business. The borrower now sells in the southern part of the city. She greatly enjoys cooking and currently works by herself from 2:00 P.M. to 9:00 P.M.

The borrower has difficulty when she goes into relapse, so she is not able to work. She is a person living with HIV/AIDS. In addition, she must deal with the crime that exists in the area where her business is located.

The borrower is single and has a one-year-old child. Her loan will be used to buy rice, tables, and chairs. Her dream is to have a house of her own where she can enjoy being with her child. She would also like to sell cola in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert was born in 1965 at Rwerere Village, Nyakagyeme Sub-county, Rujumbura County. He is married with five (05) children, with four still in school. He is a secondary school teacher working in different private schools. He used to meet his family's needs using his salary, but later he found that his salary alone could not meet all his financial needs. He decided to join UGAFODE for financial help at a time when he was constructing rentals to supplement his income.

Robert constructed the rentals in Rwerere trading center. This now supplements his income, and he also started cattle rearing for milk production. The client took this loan to buy another cow to increase milk production. His plan is for his wife to be in charge of the milk sales. The client is thankful to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial assistance extended to him. The loans have enabled him to educate his children and to construct rentals. He would like UGAFODE to continue supporting low income earners, since this improves people’s standards of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Bassel

texts.en:
Bassel is a 25-year-old single man, who has been working selling nuts since seven years ago. He started his own business in 2010, at the same shop where he used to work as an employee. It's a good step forward, because he already has a good customer-base to continue from, and to expand instead of starting from the zero point.

He is working on increasing the product diversity and replying to customers needs. That's why he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his roastery capital with special Chinese and Japanese nuts that will attract customers' attention and increase his income.

He is looking forward to keep developing his business to improve both his social and financial situations.

loans.use: to increase his roastery capital with special Chinese and Japanese nuts.

loans.name: Hassani

texts.en:
Hassani is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, he has operated a petrol selling business. He sells in a shop to motorcycle operators and neighbours. He faces a challenge of seasonality. 

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase petrol for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase petrol for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 66-year-old widower with ten children; six of the children are still attending school.  He lives in the Kanoni-Rakai district with his children. 

Joseph is a farmer who has a banana plantation. He has been in agricultural business since 1993. He sells his agriculture products to traders from Kampala who usually come twice in a week. He hopes to be the leading supplier of matooke (bananas) in Kanoni.

He is a teacher, but started this banana business since he had done it before, and he finds it is easy to monitor while he continues his teaching job.

Joseph has acquired a loan of 700,000 shs to buy pesticides and manure for treating his banana plantation, with the hope of obtaining a high yield. His challenges are a new banana disease that attacks his plantations, and clients who take products on credit and then delay settling the debts.

He describes himself as a honest man.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Fefecia

texts.en:
Fefecia live in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 32 years old. She is single and has two children between ages 5 and 10. She did not attend school, so she decided to join into business to enable her to help herself with her expenses.  

For three years now she has been selling bread, biscuits, and soft drinks in the community market. One of the problems she faces is small income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes enables her to buy food in her home. This makes her proud of her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bread, biscuits, and soft drinks for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread, biscuits, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man who has been working in the mobile phone selling business for 11 years. He was only 23 years old when he started working to make his own living. In 2011, Ali opened his own mobile phone selling shop, and he is developing it gradually to fulfill customers needs. Ali is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with newly released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards.

Ali will work hard on expanding his business and will put much effort on attracting customers' attention through offers and new technologies.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with newly released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She mentioned the high cost of transportation as her major challenge. Anna dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil, to resell at her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loan capital, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
This is Mejumaa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 50,000 shillings to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children.

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 22 years old. He lives in the small village of Vani District with his parents. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. Specifically, they have a milking cow whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have a vineyard with 200 grape vines and agricultural land where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese at local markets. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, George will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, he will be able to sow cucumbers, tomatoes, and greens. George will sell the harvested products locally at a good price, increasing the family income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 32 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She was single and has three children aged 3, 16, and 19 years old. For the past three years, she been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the community market. She likes the response to her business. She spends 12 hours a day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and meat for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and meat for her business,

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a single woman; she lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

Regina has operated a shop kiosk business for the past four years. In addition, she also operates a butcher shop which is another source of livelihood. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen.  

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.  With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar. 

She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas  nació en la comunidad de Viscochoni pero vive  en la comunidad de Mika. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 55 años de edad, es casado por este lazo matrimonial tiene cinco hijos. 

Lucas es un padre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lucas was born in the community of Viscochoni, but now lives in the community of Mika. The community of Mika is located in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

Lucas is 55 years old, married, and has five children. He is an enterprising and hardworking father who works as a farmer and rancher. He has several plots of land on which he grows potatoes, barley, corn, oca, and other crops.

A group of neighbors invited him to participate in the “Intipakareq” Communal Bank because he is a responsible and cheerful person. Lucas is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy fertilizers and seeds. He thanks everyone for this loan and promises to be punctual with his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 33 años de edad , esta casada con Faustino de 37 años con quien edifico su vivienda a base de material noble en donde vive junto a su hija de 9 años. Posee un negocio dedicado a la venta de locería y otros productos hechos a base de plástico.
Anteriormente se desempeñaba como empleada en una tienda de similar rubro siéndole de mucha ayuda para ganar experiencia y por consiguiente iniciarse en un negocio propio con el tiempo.
Luego de 5 años como empleada y logrando acumular dinero para ser usado como capital adquirió algo de mercadería el cual consideraba de mayor demanda e inicio sus ventas de manera ambulatoria por los anexos y zonas rurales de su localidad en donde no existen comercios dedicados al rubro. Comenta que es una labor muy entretenida por tener buen talento y trato con sus clientes logrando así hacer de su negocio un buen sustento para su economía familiar.
Constantemente tiene el apoyo de su esposo con quien día a día expende diversos productos tales como vasos, platos, tinas entre otros.Uno de sus deseos a futuro es la de mejorar su negocio hasta el punto de abrir una tienda mayorista en su domicilio y porque no la apertura de algunas sucursales.
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y adquirir mas mercadería para su negocio tales como jarras, escobas y baldes.
texts.en:
Antonia is 33 years old and married to 37 year old Faustino.  They live in a solidly built home and have a nine year old daughter.  [Antonia] has a business where she sells plastic goods.

She used to work as an employee in a similar type of store, and this helped her gain lots of experience, so she eventually decided to start her own business.  After five years as an employee, she was able to save up enough to buy some merchandise which she considered to be in high demand and began making sales on foot in rural areas where there were no similar businesses.  She says that her work is very entertaining because she has a good talent and treats her customers well.  She has made her business into a financial support system for her family

She has her husband’s constant encouragement and she sells products such as cups, plates, and other things daily.  One of her desires for the future is to improve her business to the point where she can open a large store in her home and some branches.

She is asking for 1,000 PEN so she can buy more merchandise, such as pitchers, brooms, and pails for her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Luis Hernan

texts.es:
Luis tiene 33 años de edad es soltero vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.



Es integrante de ventanilla Unión Central Parroquia San José del  Tambo actividad económica agricultura, 

crianza de animales  y comercio la comunidad se encuentra a una hora de la cooperativa.




Luis  se dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de cacao. 



Solicita el crédito para limpiar las huertas y tener una mejor producción.   



Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Mata de Cacao.  




Su sueño es tener un negocio.  



El desafío que enfrenta es la  falta de capital para trabajar.
