The previous loan helped her increase her income and number of customers and she used the income to feed her children and for the other household expenses.  Thanks to this Kiva loan she can pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Ricaurte

texts.en:
Ricaurte is a native of Colombia. He is married and has one child.  Ricaurte has more than 12 years of experience as a beauty supply store manager.  A couple years ago, Ricaurte started planning to have his own business. He started working with LEDC Small Business Department receiving technical assistant to create a business plan, implement his accounting systems, and obtain his licenses. 

Finally this year, he found a good location to start his business in Beltsville, MD. With a  LEDC loan of $10,000 and his own savings, he quit his job and  signed a lease agreement to open his beauty supply store and fulfill his dream to be the owner of his own business. He is hoping to have the same success as in the other stores that he  managed. That will give him the additional income to support his family, buy a new house, and send his child to college.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his beauty supply company in Beltsville, Maryland.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida, de 39 años de edad , esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Nelida se dedica a la venta de pollos. Continuamente compra la cantidad de aves que necesita para cumplir con el envío hacia los pueblos ribereños en donde tiene clientes que realizan pedidos semanales. En algunas ocasiones envía pollos vivos mientras que en otras oportunidades los envía ya muertos , aderezados y cortadas por presas. Asegura que este trabajo requiere de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar hasta los centros de abastos de pollos para adelantarse a otros vendedores que compiten en este mismo sector. Lleva en este negocio más de 4 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio .
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de pollos grandes para su negocio .
texts.en:
Nelida, 39, is married and the mother of two children who live with her in her own house.

Nelida makes a living selling chickens.  She always buys the number of birds she needs to make her shipment to the coastal areas where she has customers who make weekly requests.  Sometimes she sends live chickens while other times she sends them already dead, seasoned, and cut into pieces.

She says this job requires a lot of sacrifice because in order to get the good and fresh products she sells to her customers she has to get up early to go to the chicken distribution centers to get ahead of other vendors who compete in this same sector.

She has been in this business for more than four years.  She works alone and says the desire to do things well and generate income for her family are her main motivation to strive for progress.

She's requesting 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] and she's grateful to those who are giving her the loan she needs to continue developing her business.  She'll invest the requested amount in buying large chickens for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old, separated and has four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair her bike so it gives a better service. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her bike so it gives a better service.

loans.name: Roario

texts.en:
Roario is 50 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo, eggs and noddles. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap, shampoo, eggs and noddles.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 44 years old, married with two children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. He has been in his business for over seven years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair the motorbike so it gives better service. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike so it gives better service.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelica is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Angelica has a hog-raising business in the Philippines. Angelica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelica has been in this business for 10 years. Angelica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es: Martín, tiene la edad  de 49 años, está en casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa y la cual  es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer  una buena preparación del terreno antes que lleguen las lluvias y hacer compra de fertilizantes y otros productos químicos como también la semilla que de un buen rendimiento en esta zona, además pagar mano de obra para la siembra y luego la asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de topografía y fertilidad del suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de estas plantas. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener y utilizarla en el bienestar  de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Martín is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his children and his wife, who are his biggest priority. With his loan, he hopes to prepare his land properly before the rains come and buy fertilizers and other chemical products as well as seed that will provide a good yield in this area. He also will pay for labor for the planting and later for help on the plantation, and this way assure himself of doing a good job. What he hopes to do is take advantage of the good topography and fertility of the land that he has for this crop, and also to put in practice several years of experience in the management of these plants. He also wants to buy the best, highest-quality products so that his plantation will be well-developed and healthy and have adequate production in the short term. He hopes to obtain income from the harvest and use it for the wellbeing of his family, to meet some family goals, and to continue investing more in the crops. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow ñampí (a root vegetable similar to a sweet potato)

loans.name: Ganga

texts.en:
Ganga is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, aged four. In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Ganga plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called 'pasal', is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 61 years old and married with five children. Antonina works very hard to provide for them.

Antonina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Antonina has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Antonina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 58 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Diosdada has a hog raising business in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Diosdada has been in this business for 13 years. Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 49 years old, married and has six children. 

Estelita is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines and additional livestock to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Estelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Danilo De Jesus

texts.es: Don Danilo  de 35 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres  hijos de 12, 7 y 3 años. Durante 23 años ha trabajado en la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol su cosechas las vende con los comerciantes que están cerca de su zona de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. El está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar abonos, semillas, pesticidas y herbicidas, y para darle una mejora a su parcela donde siembra que es la que muestra la fotografía, y así seguir cosechando sin ningún problema para que pueda obtener los ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Danilo, 35, is married and has three children, ages 12, 7, and 3.  He has worked in agriculture for 23 years.  His main crop is corn and beans.  He sells his harvests to the merchants near where he lives.  With the profits from his sales he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

He's requesting a loan to be able to buy soil amendments, seed, pesticide, and herbicide, and to improve the plot of land he plants, which is shown in the photograph.  This way he can continue growing without any problem so he can earn income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años cultiva maíz y maicillo, con las ventas que realiza de sus cultivos lleva el alimento diario a su familia puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Vive en condiciones muy sencillas y humildes junto a su familia, por eso solicita un credito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas, etc ya que son indispensables para obtener una cosecha abundante y tambien para el mejoramiento de su terreno que muestra en la fotografia, con eso espera poder continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en: Don Jorge is 49-years old.  He lives in his own house with his wife and four children.  He has made his living in agriculture for the last twenty years.  He grows corn and sorghum.  Don Jorge supports his family with the sales from his crops.  He does not have another source of income.  He and his family live very simply and humbly, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He needs the loan to purchase necessary agricultural supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides etc.  These items are essential for obtaining an abundant harvest and also for improving his land, which can be seen in the above photo.  With the loan, don Jorge hopes to be able to continue improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides and to improve his field.

loans.name: Moroni

texts.en:
As many successful business owners do, Moroni developed his latest business – Lalo’s Jumpers – to complement an already successful model. His family had already established several party supply companies, but they complained about the exorbitant costs of renting inflatable bounce houses for their clients.  

When Moroni looked into the cost and overhead of buying inflatable jumpers and operating a jump house rental business, he knew he had a great idea for a profitable business. 

After attending Accion Texas Inc.’s La Idea Business Workshop in Dallas, Moroni was more excited than ever to start his own business. Not only did he have an idea, but he knew he could count on technical assistance and funding from Accion in order to bring that idea to fruition.  

With low overhead and sufficient storage to work from home, Moroni is using Accion funding to purchase inflatable jumpers and equipment. Moroni said he knows that his business will succeed because he knows that the demand for inflatable jumpers for children’s parties is tremendous. 

Moroni is starting his business part-time on the weekends to supplement other income, but soon he hopes to expand into a full-time business. He hopes to use Accion’s technical assistance and workshops to achieve this goal in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase inflatable jumpers and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Ma. Nelia

texts.en:
Ma. Nelia is 43 years old and has ten children. Ma. Nelia is married and has eight children who are in school.

Ma. Nelia is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Nelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Nelia has been in pig-fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is 46 years old and married with six children.

Annaly is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Annaly requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers.

Annaly has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is married and she works hard to support her family.

Ana Marie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to purchase fertilizers for her rice field.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 61 years old and widowed with five children.

Cristita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Cristita aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: This time, Cirila is applying for a new loan of PHP 29,500 to buy ingredients for her native foods (bibingka). Her business, which was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA, continues to provide for Cirila and her family, increasing their income and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her native foods.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos. El vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, todos los miembros de la familia trabajan y no tienen ayuda del extranjero; el negocio lo aprendió desde muy joven, ya que sus padres se lo inculcaron, trabaja en tierra alquilada, no posee horario establecido. 
El préstamo  que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas, pesticidas; esta inversión le permitirá tener todo lo necesario  para trabajar y tener buenas cosechas.
Su sueño es tener casa propia y tener éxitos en la cosecha.
texts.en:
José makes his living growing basic grains.  He lives with his family, his wife and his children.  Every member of his family works; they have no outside help.  José learned the business very young.  His parents instilled it in him.  He works on rented land and does not have a regular schedule.  
José needs the loan, which will allow him to buy agricultural supplies, such as compost, insecticides, pest-control substances, herbicides and pesticides.  This investment will allow José to have everything he needs to work and have good harvests. 
José's dream is to have his own house and successful harvests.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as compost, insecticides, pest-control substances, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elizabeth successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her variety store business.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Eva is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture-making. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 73 years old and a widowed mother of five children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Milagros has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Milagros aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Immar Otoniel

texts.es:
Immar tiene 21 años de edad y una familia conformada por su padre, madre y sus hermanos que son cinco entre 23, 15 y 12 años de edad y los mas pequeños entre una edad de 10 a 7 que están en casa.
Él se dedica a trabajar en un restaurante desde hace  4 años, a demás se dedica en sus días de descanso a trabajar en su casa, ayuda a su papá en la siembra del maíz también a la cargada de leña para su casa es una familia muy feliz y muy unida  que comparte el día a día. Él es una persona muy conocida de la zona tiene buena relación con los vecinos, respetuoso con todas las persona. los insumos agrícolas como la semilla, el fertilizante, el pesticida que se utiliza para control de plagas y otras cosas como los alimentos básicos para la casa,  los compra en la ciudad para llegar ahí debe caminar 4 kilómetros desde su casa hasta la ciudad y la dificultad que se le presenta es que hay momentos que no hay transporte tan seguido para poder transportar las compras para eso él tiene pensado comprar una motocicleta para ser mas fácil el transportarse de su casa a su trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una motocicleta; para facilitar el transportarse de su casa hasta su trabajo, y también para una emergencia que ocurra en el transcurso del diario de vivir. La necesidad que se lograría satisfacer es la de facilitar su traslado de los insumo agrícolas a su casa para poder trabajar con su padre en al siembra del maíz, a la vez no solo de poder transportar los alimentos también transportarse al trabajo por que a ellos les queda muy lejos  la ciudad. Como es su primer crédito piensa salir bien con este  para que a futuro poder solicitar un nuevo crédito por cualquier necesidad que se le presente ya que a pensado que es una buena opción trabajar con fundación campo y ademas poder construir su propia casa cerca donde vive su padres.
texts.en:
Immar is 21 years old and his family consists of his father, his mother, and his five siblings. The youngest, who are at home, are 7 and 10 and the others are 12, 15, and 23 years old. 

He has worked in a restaurant for 4 years. He also works at home on his days off. He helps his father to grow corn as well as carrying firewood to his house. His family is very happy and close-knit, and they share the day-to-day. He is very well-known in the area. He has a good relationship with the neighbors and is respectful to everyone. In the city, he buys agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizer, and pesticide that they use to control infestations, as well as other things such as basic household groceries. To get there he has to walk 4 kilometers from his house to the city, and the difficulty is that there are times when transportation is not very frequent for him to transport the purchases. Because of this, he has been thinking of buying a motorcycle to make it easier to get from his house to his job.

He is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to buy a motorcycle to make it easier for him to get from his house to his job, and also for emergencies that occur in daily life. The need that it will satisfy is to make it easier for him to carry agricultural supplies to his house in order to be able to help his father grow corn, and also to transport not only food but also himself to his job because his family is very far from the city. Since this is his first loan, he wants to succeed with it so that in the future he can ask for another loan for any need that presents itself. He thinks that working with Fundación Campo is a good option. He also wants to be able to build his own house near where his parents live.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to make it easier to get from his house to his job

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products (chickens, meat, bologna sausage, sausages, flour and others), to increase her quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire a full-time employee and pay for costs associated with maintaining her website.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Margie successfully paid back her previous loan to further improve her food stall business.

NWTF is re-listing Margie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Shanikqu

texts.en:
Ever since she was a little girl, Shanikqu loved styling hair and dreamed of owning a salon.  
 
As soon as she graduated from high school in her hometown of Mesquite, Texas, she wasted no time at all and enrolled in cosmetology school. She knew this was a career she would love – and that it would also sustain her growing family for the long term.
 
At first, Shanikqu rented a chair in a local salon, earning money via a wage split with the salon owner.  However, she also earned commissions from her most loyal customers, and after several years of careful saving, she began to purchase her own equipment and supplies.  
 
Then, at last, it was time to take that next step to achieve her dream of establishing her very own salon, and Accion Texas was there to help. Shanikqu was able to use her Accion Texas Inc. loan for working capital. In addition to purchasing her last bit of needed inventory, the loan funds were used to help pay for the initial costs of moving into a salon space.  
 
Shanikqu is now the proud owner of The Glam Hair Studio.To learn more, visit www.theglamhairstudio.com.

loans.use: to cover moving costs and inventory.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 30-year-old woman. She lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children and is a responsible and hard-working housewife. 

Fozia's husband sells cement sacks in the main market which is the only source of income for the family. However, his monthly net income is not enough to meet the household's needs.

Fozia has requested a loan for her husband in the amount of PKR 20,000 from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan, her husband will purchase cement sacks to sell. By doing so, he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. 

Fozia is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cement sacks for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 37 años de edad es una mujer buena y amable. Tiene 3 hijos. Vive junto a ellos en la casa de su madre el cual comparte con sus hermanos.El trabajo de Ana, consiste en el la venta de collares, aretes, pulseras y diversos accesorios sobre todo para las niñas. Diariamente coloca todos sus productos cerca de la puerta de ingreso de un colegio hasta donde llegan sus clientes en busca de novedosos productos. Su labor empieza desde las 7 de la mañana y culmina al acercarse la noche. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad cerca de 4 años, generalmente trabaja sola pero en algunas ocasiones le ayuda su hija mayor. Le agrada su trabajo porque las ganancias que recibe superan mucho a la inversión inicial en cada compra que ella realiza, espera mas adelante poner una tienda, pero por ahora lo que más desea es aumentar su capital de trabajo para incrementar la cantidad y variedad de artículos que ofrece a la venta.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral.Con el monto solicitado comprará juguetes, collares, pulseras y otros accesorios que continuará ofreciendo en su puesto de ventas.
texts.en: Ana is 37 years old. She is a good and friendly woman. She has 3 children, and she lives with them in her mother's house, which she shares with her siblings. Ana sells necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and a variety of accessories, mostly for girls. Every day she places her products near the entrance to a school where her customers come looking for new products. Her work starts at 7 in the morning and ends around nightfall. She has been doing this work for around 4 years. She generally works alone, but sometimes her oldest daughter helps her. She enjoys her job because the income she receives far exceeds the initial investment she makes. She hopes to open a store in the future, but for now what she wants most is to increase her working capital in order to expand the quantity and variety of items she offers for sale. This time, she will request 2,000 nuevos soles. She is very happy to know that there are people who back her economically to continue developing her work. With the amount requested, she will buy toys, necklaces, bracelets, and other accessories that she will continue offering at her stand.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, earrings, and necklaces, among others

loans.name: Milvia

texts.es:
Milvia, de 31 años de edad,esta casada con Wilson quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es padre de sus 3 hijos. Juntos habitan su casa propia el cual obtuvieron hace poco tiempo.La actividad que realiza Milvia es la venta de diversas golosinas como cereales, galletas, chicles, caramelos y chocolates, además complementa sus ventas con bebidas heladas de diversas marcas y sabores. A establecido su pequeño negocio en el frontis de su vivienda, ahí a diario coloca una vitrina que contiene los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, mientras que las bebidas las coloca en una refrigeradora que tiene en su casa. Se inició hace 5 años en este negocio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.Comenta que decidió emprender esta actividad por el deseo de contar con un negocio propio que le generen los recursos económicos necesarios para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos básicos del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800, está agradecida y contenta por contar con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con su negocio. 
El monto solicitado lo invertirá progresivamente en la compra de bebidas y diversas golosinas como galletas, caramelos, cereales y chocolates para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Milvia is 31 years old. She is married to Wilson, who works as a civil constructor. Together they have 3 children. They live in their own house, which they acquired a short time ago.  
Milvia sells snacks such as cereals, cookies, bubble gum, sweets and chocolates. She also complements her sales with cool drinks from different brands and flavors. She has set up her business in the front side of her house, where ever day she places a display cabinet with the products she offers to her customers. She keeps the cool drinks in a fridge inside her house. 
Milvia started her business five years ago and manages it on her own. She says she decided to start this activity due to her wish to have a business of her own that generated income to help her partner with the household expenses.
She is asking for 1800 nuevos soles. She is grateful and happy to have the financial support she needs to progress with her business. She will invest the money in the gradual purchase of drinks and different snacks such as cookies, sweets, cereals and chocolates so she can keep working.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, cookies, sweets, chocolate and others.

loans.name: Ernesto  Nelson

texts.es: Don Ernesto de 51 años de edad vive en casa  propia con su grupo familiar que lo conforman su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 18, 15, 12, 10 y 7 años ellos estudian actualmente, tiene gran experiencia en el trabajo agrícola ya que tiene 25 años de realizar dicha actividad es una persona responsable con su familia y laboriosa, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir sus compromisos familiares. Don Ernesto esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar insumos agricolas como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbisidas, entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y asi seguirle dando a su familia una mejor vida sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Ernesto, who is 51 years old, lives in his own home with his family, which comprises his wife and thier five children, who are eighteen, fifteen, twelve, ten, and seven, and are currently in school. He has a lot of farming experience, since he has worked in this business for 25 years. He is a hard worker and a responsible family man. He works growing corn and beans, and his sales allow him to cover his family's expenses. 

Ernesto is requesting a loan so that he can purchase farming supplies: fertilizer, seed, weed-killers, and other items he needs for his crops. This will allow him to continue giving his family a better life without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies like fertilizer, seed, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Now, she has requested another loan, of PHP 19,000, through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store. Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 57 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 30,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase new crops and fertilizer, such as manure. She wants to make improvements to her house, and she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new crops and fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Ma. Edwina

texts.en:
Ma. Edwina is 40 years old and married, with four children.

Ma. Edwina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items, like snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.

Ma. Edwina has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Ma. Edwina aspires to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her store, like snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Jessi

texts.es:
Jessi, de 34 años de edad , esta casada con Isac y tiene 2 hijos que son su motivo de inspiración y esfuerzo  para seguir adelante. Vive en su casa propia junto a todos los miembros de su familia.El trabajo de Jessi consiste en la venta de frutas regionales como mandarinas,naranjas, coconas, mangos y otros, además pone a la venta diversas galletas, caramelos, chicles y chocolates. Ha establecido su puesto de ventas en el frontis de su vivienda hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 1 año y asegura que le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo disponible para poder realizar múltiples actividades en su hogar como atender a su hijo mas pequeño, le esta yendo muy bien y espera que su negocio continúe creciendo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600 soles, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para seguir adelante con su trabajo , además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará frutas regionales como mandarinas y cocona, además comprarás mas golosinas como caramelos, galletas y chicles.
texts.en:
Jessi, 34, is married to Isac and has two children, who are her inspiration and encouragement for getting ahead.  She lives in her own house along with all the members of her family.

Jessi's job is selling regional fruits such as mandarins, oranges, coconas, mangos, and others.  She also sells a variety of cookies, candy, gum, and chocolate.  Her customers go to the front of her house, where she has set up her business.

She has done this work for about a year and thinks it's going very well for her.  What she likes about her job is that she has time available to do a lot of household activities such as take care of her youngest child.  It's going very well for her and she hopes her business continues to grow.

Currently she'll request 600 soles [PEN].  With the requested amount she'll buy local fruit such as mandarins and coconas.  She'll also buy more sweets such as candy, cookies, and gum.

She's very happy about this financial support so she can continue to get ahead with her job.  In addition, she promises to make all her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy regional fruits and sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies, such as fabric, thread, zippers, needles, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Don Gerardo de 43 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijo. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijo se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y sorgo con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Gerardo desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en: Gerardo, 43 years old, is a man who is very responsible with his family obligations, since he has always been known for giving his children the best. Currently he lives with his wife and their 4 children. He is a farmer and grows corn and sorghum. With the sales from his harvest, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. Gerardo wants to increase his sales, so he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy seed and manure, among other items, in order to continue bringing his family their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, seed, etc.

loans.name: Aranes

texts.en:
Aranes recently opened her business, Erez Essentials, in an antiques market in Frisco, Texas, offering preserved flowers, organic candles and organic decorative products.  
 
Aranes is an artist, born and raised in the Dominican Republican. She met a man from the United States and decided to marry him and follow him to the U.S. But she found herself missing the flowers from her home country. She soon discovered a method for drying, preserving and transporting flowers.  After moving to Texas, she discovered the niche that would become the foundation of her business—a special flower preservation technique that wasn’t being used in Texas.
 
Soon she was expanding her business idea to include other niche products that don’t exist in the Texas market.  After observing her husband’s and son’s apparent allergies to artificial candles, she discovered there was a lack of organic candle-makers in the area, and has now added this and other organic decorative products to her business.
 
Aranes said she is passionate about Accion Texas Inc.’s mission. Coming from the non-profit world herself, Aranes said was thrilled when she learned Accion Texas would give her business a chance, when no one else would.
 
With her working capital loan, Aranes has been purchasing inventory, paying the rent for retail space and creating promotional materials. She is also developing a website.

loans.use: to rent a retail space, create promotional materials, and also develop a website.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 32 years old and a hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and one daughter. Her husband has been driving a taxi for eight years, and this is the only source of income for her family.
 
Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required in the engine of the taxi. Because of this, it’s almost impossible for her husband to get good earnings from it. Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to raise the amount needed for repairing the engine of her husband's taxi, so that he can drive it properly. With the profit amount, her husband would buy one more taxi in future.

Shehnaz desires to provide quality education to her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay the cost of repairing her husband's taxi

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

Tessie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her rice retailing and frozen foods businesses. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of rice to sell to her customers.

NWTF is presenting Tessie's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconut palms and producing copra, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 4,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011. Now, she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She wants to make improvements to her house, and to improve the general living conditions of her family, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her coconut palms

loans.name: Miguel Alfonso

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 79 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Desde los 12 años de edad trabaja como jornalero, cultivando la tierra. Los insumos que necesita los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a treinta minutos y los traslada en vehiculo hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivar maíz y maicillo y una parte venderla y la otra destinarla para el consumo familiar. De esta manera, podrá comprar a mejor precio porque comprara de una sola vez en mayor cantidad y podrá ahorrarse dinero para que le sirva para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Miguel is 79 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children. He has been working as a laborer, farming the land, since he was twelve years old. He acquires the supplies he needs in a town thirty minutes away and transports them back home in a vehicle.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to purchase farming supplies to grow corn and sorghum. He will sell part of it and use the rest for his family's consumption. This will allow him to buy supplies at a lower price because he will make one large purchase, and he will be able to save money for use in the next harvest.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers and four sacks of manure to grow his crops.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and a hardworking woman.

Gulzar’s husband’s salary is not enough to meet the family’s household needs, so she is running a small business to help ends meet. She buys new shawls, then resells them at a profit. The shawls she sells are liked by everyone for their variety.

Currently the stock of her shawls is low, so Gulzar is interested in buying more in different colors to sell. She is applying for a 28,000 PKR loan through Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to increase her net income and save for the future. She plans to use her profits to better educate her children.

Gulzar feels very confident and satisfied in taking this loan, as this amount will help her to manage the household expenses and cover her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more shawls to sell.

loans.name: Cherrie Rose

texts.en:
Cherrie Rose is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business selling a native food called "bibingka," in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Cherrie Rose requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food business. Cherrie Rose would like to save money in the future, for expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jeneta

texts.en: Jeneta is 38 years old, married with four children. She lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a general store in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over fice years and earns 40,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 60,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noddles, shampoo, soap, sugar and coffee. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noddles, shampoo, soap, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 42 years old, married with six children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, and noodles. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, and noodles

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks.  Editha is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell to customers.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rasheedan is 48 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of five children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for his family. He works very hard to meet the household expenses but due to his insufficient income he is facing problems meeting the needs of his family. 

Mrs. Rasheedan, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan amount her husband will purchase a variety of furniture for resale. By doing so he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Rasheedan is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profit. She wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of furniture to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 28 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Dinah is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dinah has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from selling dried fish.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Eliseo

texts.es: Don Jorge de 47 años de edad, es muy responsable y trabajador, vive con su familia en casa propia. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en la que actualmente esta sembrano maiz y sorgo sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando ya estan listos los almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografia pra luego salir a venderlos con los comerciantes de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Jorge solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas. Don Jorge ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad
texts.en:
Jorge, who is 47 years old, is very responsible and a hard worker. He lives with his family in the home he owns. He works very hard on his plot of land, where he is currently growing corn and sorghum. His products are very high quality. Once they are ready, he stores them in the sacks shown in the picture and then goes out and sells them to the local basic grain vendors in his area. 

Jorge is requesting a loan in order to have enough money to invest in the purchase of farming supplies like pest control and fertilizing products, seed, and other items. Jorge wants to increase his sales so that he can obtain higher earnings and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 45-year-old widow who has four children. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.

For the past nineteen years Zenaida has planted, harvested and sold coconuts in order to make a living. Each month she earns 29,980 PHP.

Zenaida joined GDMPC in 2011 to seek guidance and assistance. She is now applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to progress in her business so she can cover her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly, 66, is widowed and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

For the past 26 years Nelly has run a general store in the Philippines. She has previously taken out loans through Kiva. She is now applying for a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Nelly aspires to save enough money to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 37 years old and an independent women. She has three children. Her husband died six years ago. She has been pursuing a clothing sales business from her house for 11 years, and this is the only source of income for her family. Due to the large household expenses, and being the sole supporter of her family, she is facing a lot of problems in life.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by opening a garment shop in the market, because she is not getting enough customers at her house. She would also buy some new variety of shirts and dresses, to attract more customers. This would increase her sales and, ultimately, her income level. This loan could help her to increase her monthly income and savings, for the better future of her children. Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan, for helping her.

loans.use: To move her clothing shop from her home to a public market, and to buy a greater variety of clothing to resell, in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Anita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Mrs Sonia is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of four children. She owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidered clothing are liked by everyone. 

Presently, her stock of embroidery material is almost gone. Therefore, she is interested in purchasing a variety of embroidery materials including colorful threads, beads, stones, needle and clothes. 

For that reason, Mrs Sonia has requested a loan of 38,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her business. With the profit, she wants to construct her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profit to easily pay back the loan as well as construct her house.

She is feeling very happy after taking the loan because this will help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Alexandrina

texts.en: Alexandrina is taking a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better now that she has applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is 36 years old. He lives in Gelati village, Tkibuli district, with his 33-year-old wife, his retired mother and his two-year-old son. Iuri requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 milk cows, 2 calves, a vineyard and plot of agricultural land.  The cows are milked every day to make dairy products. From the harvested grapes family makes wine and vodka. All the products are sold locally at the markets so the family gets a small monthly income.

Iuri requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Iuri has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Iuri will purchase chicks. He already has cages ready for them. After buying the chicks, Iuri will raise them and sell as chickens at a good price. This will bring him a good profit. Part of the profit will be  reinvested in the same business, in order to expand his poultry. Another part will be used for family well-being. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase chicks

loans.name: Maria Expectacion

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer de 58 años de edad, luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa, soltera. Ella tiene 3 hijos 2 de ellos ya mayores de edad, casados cada uno en hogar y la menor que esta estudiando en secundaria la cual vive con ella y ayuda a su madre con las diferentes actividades y quehaceres en el hogar. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo de hortaliza (papa) desde hace mucho tiempo y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron esta actividad desde muy pequeña que ha sido medio de sustento para su familia por muchos años. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 100 metros de su casa de habitación lo cual le permite estar al pendiente de los mismos y la única ayuda que ella tiene es su hija y en ocasiones sus hijos mayores ya que ellos también viven de la agricultura. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y familiares; pero como toda siembra y cultivo no deja de tener riesgo siendo estos las plagas y la variación de precios en el mercado. 

Actualmente Doña María solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa comprando fertilizantes, abono, y bombas para fumigación a su producto para que ayude a mantenerlo sano y limpio de plagas.

Su meta es poder cultivar una variedad de productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y demás, que ellos tengan más opciones de compra ya que de esa manera ella podrá generar más ingresos para su familia y podrá invertir en sus cultivos hasta poder trabajar con capital propio. Su Sueño es ver a su hija graduada a nivel universitario con una carrera de provecho para que ella se haga cargo de sus tierras y con el tiempo de la administración del negocio para que ella genere empleo.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and single. She is a real fighter. She completed her primary education. She has three children, two of whom are married adults who live in their own homes, and her youngest daughter, who is in secondary school and lives with her. She helps her mother with different household chores and tasks. She has a lot of experience growing vegetables (potatoes). She has been farming for a long time. Her parents taught her the trade when she was very young, so it has been her family's source of income for many years. Her crops are located 100 meters from her home, which allows her to see to them. Her only help is her daughter, and occasionally her older children, since they also make a living as farmers. Her product is sold through local distributors, neighbors, and relatives. Like with any crops, there is always some risk involved due to pests and price fluctuations in the market. 

Currently María is requesting help in order to invest in her potato crops. She will buy fertilizers and pumps to fumigate her product in order to help keep it healthy and clear of pests.

Her goal is to grow a variety of products to offer her customers, so that they can have more purchasing options. This would allow her to generate more income for her family and invest in her crops in order to work with her own capital. Her dream is to see her daughter graduate from university and obtain a useful degree so she may take charge of her land and, eventually, manage the business and create employment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pumps to fumigate her potato crops.

loans.name: Shehrish Group

texts.en:
Shehrish is 23--young, energetic and a hard-working woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and one son. Her husband is an auto mechanic by profession and his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses.
 
Shehrish wants to educate her son in a good school so that he can have a bright future. Currently she can’t send him to a good school due to their financial constraints, because of which she is much worried about his future.

 She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She is a very skilled woman and she wants to open a beauty parlor in her house to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She would purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, creams, facial scrubs, make-up kits, etc. and would also purchase some chairs for her salon. She is very hopeful for this loan as she could start her business from this loan. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her child and to pay back her installments.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products for beauty salon

loans.name: Sherwin John

texts.en: Sherwin John is 29 years old and single. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over four years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. And now he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires.  He joined GDMPC  to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, he wants to make improvements on his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Mubashira

texts.en:
Mrs. Mubashira is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of four children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband is a brick seller. He purchase bricks from a brick kiln and sells them in the market, at profitable prices. This small business is the only source of income for the family.  

Mrs. Mubashira has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. With the help of this loan amount, her husband will purchase a greater quantity of bricks and sell them in the main market. By doing so, he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. He is hoping that the loan will be a productive one for his business. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bricks, for her husband to resell at the market

loans.name: Azucena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Azucena, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, bolsones, entre otros productos, lo realiza desde hace 15 años y lo lleva a cabo de casa en casa, asimismo en su casa de habitación. Ella vive con su hija de 29 años de edad, no tiene familiares en el extranjero que le ayuden.
El préstamo que requiere es para comprar ropa nueva, paraguas, sombrillas, bolsones, entre otros; este le permitirá tener variedad de mercadería para ofrecerle a los clientes y estar actualizada con la moda, también incrementaran sus ventas.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más amplio para brindarles una mejor atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Azucena works selling new clothing, bags, and other products. She has been doing this for fifteen years and does business door to door, as well as at home. She lives with her 29-year-old daughter and doesn't have relatives abroad to help her.

The loan she is requesting is to buy new clothing, umbrellas, parasols, and other items. It will allow her to have a variety of merchandise to offer her customers and keep up with fashion trends. Her sales will also increase.

Her dream is to expand her business so that she can give her customers better service.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing, umbrellas, parasols, bags, and other items.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a second-hand clothes business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as clothes, shorts and pants. She opened her second-hand clothes business in 2009 with her own working capital of $200.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy clothes, shorts and pants

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 52-year-old widow and mother of four children. She works as a Community Development Coordinator with the Luwero Diocese, helping people in her area to improve their health and well-being. She has been involved with Solar Sister for a couple of months. She uses her extra income from selling solar products to help her pay school fees and buy household items.

She likes being a Solar Sister, because it adds to her income and has helped her to minimize her own expenditures on fuel for lighting. Being a Solar Sister has also made many new friends for her, as there are currently eight other Solar Sister entrepreneurs in her district. Sarah's dreams for the future are that she will continue to earn money for her family, and that her children will be well-educated and healthy.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to resell in her community.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 34 years old and married. She has two children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for ten years, and she also earns an income from prepared food vending.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stocks of groceries to resell at her store. Jinky has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to resell at her store.

loans.name: Coralia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Coralia, se dedica a la venta de frijoles, arroz y tortillas. Ella es mayor de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 17 años de edad; la actividad  de la venta de tortillas lo realiza desde hace 15 años, lo lleva a cabo desde las 8:00am a 5:00 pm.
El crédito que requiere le permitirá comprar maíz, frijoles y arroz para ofrecerles a los clientes; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del inventario y a obtener mejores ventas. 
Su sueño es brindarles el estudio a sus hijos  para que en el futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Coralia has a business selling beans, rice and tortillas.  She is an adult who lives with her husband and their 2 children aged 10 and 17.  She has been selling tortillas for 15 years, and to do this she works from 8am until 5pm.

Coralia needs a loan so that she can buy corn, beans and rice to offer to her customers.  With this investment, she will increase her inventory and obtain better sales.

Coralia's dream is to provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans and rice to offer to her customers

loans.name: Joylen

texts.en:
Joylen is 38 years old and married with five children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Joylen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Joylen requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Joylen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Joylen would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He lives in Kutaisi district with his wife, parents and 2-year-old son. George requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family owns commercial space rented out as a grocery shop. 
George requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his loan, George will purchase stocks of groceries and refrigerators to open a grocery shop. The previous shop renters had some problems so George ended the rental contract and decided to use his space to open his own grocery shop. He thinks the business will be profitable as the shop is already well known in the neighborhood and has permanent clients. George will reinvest the profit to expand the business and purchase more stocks of products. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of groceries and refrigerators to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Doña María Isabel es una mujer con 55 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante madre soltera con 1 solo hijo el cual es mayor de edad, trabaja en empresa privada y le ayuda con los gastos en el hogar ya que vive bajo el mismo techo y los fines de semana en la parte agrícola como ser: limpiar, abonar, fumigar y cortar la cosecha. Ella tiene 12 años de educación y actualmente trabaja como secretaria en el juzgado de paz de la zona donde ella habita. Pensando siempre que los trabajos no son permanentes ella decidió comprar un terreno hace algunos años en el cual cultiva café mismo que es comercializado en la zona en pequeña escala con los vecinos, familiares, amigos y algunos de los compradores que llegan a la zona. Dicha actividad fue inculcada por sus padres desde su juventud y lo práctica hace más de 20 años y hoy en día de manera propia. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus metas a corto plazo es poder ahorrar un capital propio y libre para trabajar de manera propia ampliando sus cultivos y entregándose mas para de esa forma trabajar para fortalecer el patrimonio familiar que será heredado por su hijo mismo que en la actualidad es el único que le ayuda.
texts.en:
Fifty-five year-old Maria Isabel is a determined woman with an entrepreneurial spirit and a desire for self-improvement and success. She is a single mother and has a son of legal age. He works for a private company and helps her with the household expenses because they live together. On weekends he also assists in the agricultural work; cleaning, fertilizing, fumigating and collecting the harvest. Maria has 12 years of education and she currently works as a secretary in the court house in her district. 

Being of the mindset that jobs are never permanent, she decided to buy some land a few years ago to cultivate coffee. She sells the coffee in her district on a small scale to neighbours, relatives, friends and some purchasers who come to the district.  Her parents taught her how to perform this activity in her youth and she has been doing it for more than 20 years. Nowadays she has her own way of doing things. 

She is currently requesting help to buy fertilizers and manure to nurture her coffee crop so that there will be a healthy and bountiful harvest to make a good profit. She will be able to reinvest the profit she makes into the same crop. 

Her short-term goals are to save money to be able to work in her own way to increase her crops and to begin dedicating more time to this work to strengthen her family's estate which will be inherited by her son, who is currently the only one who helps her.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure to nurture her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, sweet bread, curds, materials for tamales and the remaining money to cover the balance of the loan.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, ya que los créditos son una fuente generadora de ganancias; este le permitirá comprar gallinas, vitaminas, asimismo mejorar la galera.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer y tener más grande el negocio. Las condiciones económicas  y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
María is seeking a new loan as she needs to invest more in her business.  The loans help her to generate profits.  This loan will enable her to buy hens and vitamins, and also to make improvements to her chicken coop.

Her last loan helped her to grow and expand her business.  Her family's finances and general circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy hens and vitamins, and also to make improvements to her chicken coop.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her four children. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income.

Since 2008, she has been working as a tailor. She provides stitching services in her community. Her eldest daughter also helps her in stitching up dresses. She has excellent stitching skills and due to the money she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to purchase one more sewing machine as her number of customers are increasing day by day. However, because of having only one machine she cannot easily cope up with all customers on time and that results in a loss of money and customers. 

Therefore, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine which will allow her to fulfill the demands of customers more efficiently and to elevate her level of income. 

With the profit, she wishes to start a general store business in her home selling a variety of products including biscuits, tea packs and rice. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to stitch dresses.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Jesusa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling seafood. Jesusa is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 45 years old, married and has four children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like bread, sardines, noddles, sugar and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, sardines, noddles, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosa Nolberta

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 25 años de edad, casada, emprendedora, luchadora con muchos sueños y deseos de superarse. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria completa y madre de una hija de 5 años de edad la cual vive con ella. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar en el cultivo de café como ser: siembra, poda, fertilización, corta de cosecha y la mecanización del cultivo. Ella agradece infinitamente a sus padres por haberle enseñado a trabajar en esta actividad ya que ha sido medio de sustento para su familia y en la actualidad para su hogar del cual pueden cubrir las necesidades básicas como ser: alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas con muchas restricciones, etc. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café ya que esto permitirá que se mantenga sano y limpio de cualquier plaga y enfermedad.

Su meta es seguir estudiando a nivel universitario ya que por medio de esto ella podrá escoger una carrera que le brinde el conocimiento necesario para hacer crecer técnicamente sus cultivos. Su sueño es lograr graduar a su hija a un nivel universitario para que ella pueda crear su futuro y pueda tomar decisiones que mejoren su vida y su persona.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 25-year-old married woman.  She is hardworking and enterprising, and she has many dreams and desires to better herself.  She completed secondary school and is the mother of a 5-year-old daughter who lives with her.  

It was her parents who taught her from a very early age how to cultivate coffee: planting, pruning, fertilization, harvesting, and how to mechanize the operations.  She is infinitely grateful to her parents for having taught her how to farm, since this has been the means of sustenance for her family.  At present, this activity allows her to cover her basic household expenses such as food, clothing, medicine and the like.
