Currently she is seeking assistance so that she can buy fertilizer and compost in order to maintain her coffee crops.  This will allow her to keep her crops healthy and free of weeds and any crop disease.

Her goal is to continue studying at the university level, since this will give her the technical knowledge she needs in order to expand her crops.  Her dream is for her daughter to graduate from college so that she can create her own future and be able to make decisions that will help her grow as a person and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost in order to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nora Alicia

texts.es: Doña Nora de 37 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su hijo con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doña Nora esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semillas y herramientas para sus cultivos y tambien para mejorar el terreno donde siembra y asi pueda tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Thirty-seven year-old Nora earns a living cultivating corn and beans. She lives with her husband and their six year-old son. She is hard-working and very responsible with her family obligations. She has always been known for giving her best to her son. With the sales from her harvests she manages to cover her household expenses.

Nora is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds and tools for her crops to improve the fields where she plants. This way she will increase her income and be able to provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies: fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc. and to improve her fields.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en: Bahaa is a Lebanese single man. He is 24 years old. He is living with his parents, and one working sibling at their house that is located in one of the most beautiful villages in Lebanon. He, together with his brother, manages their family’s household. At this time, Bahaa is working non-stop to provide his family with the needed income. He has been working in his own bakery for a few years and he’s well known for his good place and delicious food.  He has loyal customers always asking for his goods. He is taking a youth loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy raw materials like flour, sugar, and butter, which he needs to continue production and expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. He has ideas about how to grow his business in the future, and he thinks of taking more Kiva loans to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like flour, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 20-year-old, single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a secondary school graduate. He is innovative and full of ideas and marketing and advertising suits him well. He also has experience in marketing and advertising. 

Mahmoud is an employee in a small marketing agency who works hard to accumulate money. He applied for a youth loan of YER 80,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy a laptop to use for his career. 

Mahmoud looks forward to improving his living conditions and opening a savings account to collect money to open his own marketing agency.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to use for his career.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina, de 35 años de edad, esta casada y vive en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 07 años de edad, instalados en su propia casa.El negocio que tiene Angelina es la venta de comestibles en general, para eso abrió una tienda en su propia casa, negocio que aprendió de su padre quien tenía su tienda en su hogar,tiene 04 años en este negocio el cual viene funcionando sin ningún problema.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa para poder atender a su pequeño hijo, así como los ingresos económicos que le sirven para comprar lo necesario en su hogar.Por tanto éste será el primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará comestibles al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros.
texts.en: Angelina is 35 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, who are aged 7 and 14. They have their own home. She has a business selling groceries. She opened a shop in her own home four years ago, and the business is functioning without any problems. She learned this business from her father, who had a shop in his home. She likes this business because it enables her to be at home so that she can take care of her young son. The income allows her to purchase what is needed in the household. This will be her first loan through Kiva. She hopes for your support so that she can put her plans into action. With the funds she is seeking, 500 nuevos soles, she will buy groceries at wholesale for her shop, such as sugar, rice, oil and other items.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, rice and oil.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mejorar sus inventarios y por la facilidad con que se le otorgan los créditos; esta inversión le permitirá comprar harina, azucar, asimismo repuestos para reparación de vehículo y para cancelar saldo pendiente.
El crédito anterior le ayudo para la comprar de material para la elaboración de pan francés y pan dulce. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y el grupo se mantiene, las condiciones económicas se han optimizado parcialmente.
texts.en:
René requires a new loan to improve his inventory and to ease the way with which loans are granted. This investment will allow him to buy flour, sugar, also spare parts to repair vehicles and to pay off pending balances.

The previous loan helped him to buy materials to make French bread and sweet bread. Family circumstances have improved and the group remains; economic conditions have partially optimized.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, spare parts to repair vehicles and to pay off pending balances.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is single and has a hardware business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her hardware business.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her hardware business

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is 31 years old and lives with her live-in partner and three children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living.  She has been in her business for over four years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional Items to sell like food and house supplies. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional Items to sell like food and house supplies

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 42-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a heart patient, and she always worries about his health. 

Her husband is a carpenter, and he has been running a wood shop for 20 years, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

Rasheeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Rasheeda will use her portion to help her husband in purchasing a wood machine and some wood material for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son.

loans.use: to purchase a wood machine.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 32 years old and has one child.

Digna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct-selling business of Avon products in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of Avon products like lipstick, powder, shoes, etc. to sell.

Digna has borrowed and paid thirteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct-selling business of Avon products for two years and also earns an income from a networking business and coconut farming.

Digna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of Avon products like lipstick, powder, shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. 

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nineteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Claudia Lissette

texts.es:
Claudia, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de primera necesidad. Ella vive con su esposo,  sus tres hijos. Claudia adquirió experiencia con la mama, ya que su madre era la propietaria del negocio.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar futas y verduras tales como: tomates, cebollas, papas, plátanos, uvas, manzanas, sandias, naranjas, entre otros; este le ayudara  a fortalecer el inventario, incrementar los ingresos y con ello aportar para su familia. 
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio, realizar una remodelación a su vivienda y optimizar el inventario.
texts.en:
Claudia makes a living selling fruits and vegetables as staple foods. She lives with her husband and her three children. 

Claudia acquired her experience with her mother since her mother was the owner of the business. 

The loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy fruits and vegetables such as: tomatoes, onions, potatoes, plantains, grapes, apples, watermelons, oranges, and other things; this will help her to stock up her inventory, increase earnings, and with it, contribute to her family. 

Her dream is to grow the business, complete a remodeling of her home, and optimize the inventory.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, plantains, grapes, apples, watermelons, oranges, and other things.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 38 years old. She lives in Ozurgeti district with her 44-year-old husband, Ilia. 

Elza requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Elza’s husband, Ilia, is working at the local restaurant as a security guard and earns a small salary, which is the only source of income for the family.

Elza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Elza has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Elza will start trading in second-hand clothes. She will purchase at wholesale price and resell with a price markup among her villagers. She will expand her business with part of the profit and earn additional income for the family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start trading in second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling peanuts and cashew nuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional peanuts and cashew nuts for her business.

Elita has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from coconut farming.

Elita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional peanuts and cashews to sell.

loans.name: Felicita Marleny

texts.es:
Felicita, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 10 meses de edad; ella posee una sala de belleza desde hace tres años, lo realiza 8:00 am a 5:00 pm; el oficio lo aprendió recibiendo clases de cosmetología en otra sala de belleza que es  un lugar cercano de donde ella reside, luego decidió independizarse y crear su propio negocio. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la comprar de tintes, shampoo, crema para manos, cosméticos, entre otros productos necesarios para la belleza; esta inversión le ayudara a tener mercadería para la venta y material oportuno para el tratamiento de uñas, cabello, entre otros. 
Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, adquirir empleados que le ayuden, asimismo mejorar la calidad de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Felicita lives with her husband and her ten month old son.  She has had a beauty salon for three years, and she works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She learned this trade by taking cosmetology classes at another beauty salon, which is close to where she lives.  She later decided to become independent and create her own business.

The loan that she needs is to buy dyes, shampoo, hand cream, and cosmetics, among other needed beauty products.  This investment will help her to have merchandise to sell and the appropriate materials to treat nails and hair, among others.

Her dream is to make her business grow and to get employees to help her.  She would also like to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, hand cream, and cosmetics, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
Melchorita is 53 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Melchorita is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy carabao (water buffalo) to use on her farm.

Melchorita has been farming sugarcane for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy carabao (water buffalo) to use on her farm.

loans.name: Ralyn

texts.en: Ralyn is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Ralyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell. Ralyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future Ralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Ana Lisseth

texts.es:
Ana, requiere de más capital de trabajo por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad  de seguir trabajando; este le permitirá comprar harina, aceite, verduras, gas, pan, carne, aderezos, entre otros productos necesarios para la actividad.
El crédito anterior le ayudo para poder elaborar variedad de antojitos, ya que logro adquirir la materia prima necesaria para elaborarlos; las circunstancias familiares se mantiene y así mismo el grupo, las condiciones económicas aumentaron parcialmente.
texts.en:
Ana needs more working capital, which is why she is requesting a new loan out of the need to continue working.  This will allow her to buy flour, cooking oil, vegetables, gas, bread, meat, and seasonings, among other products needed for her business activity.

The previous loan helped her to be able to make a variety of snacks.  This is because she managed to get the ingredients needed to make them.  Her family circumstances remain the same, and the same is true for the group.  The financial conditions have somewhat improved.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, vegetables, gas, bread, meat, and seasonings, among other products.

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque quiere más capital de trabajo por la  necesidad  de seguir en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar pollo para alinar, pollos de engorde, concentrados, leña, vacunas y gastos de transporte.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su equipo de trabajo, ya que logro reparar y enllantar un camión que posteriormente lo vendió; el grupo familiar es el mismo, las condiciones económicas y circunstancias familiares han cambiado.
texts.en:
Maria is requesting a new loan because she wants to have more working capital in order to continue with her business.  This loan will allow her to buy chicken meat to season, chickens to fatten, chicken feed, firewood, and vaccines, and to pay for transportation costs.

With her previous loan, she improved her work equipment; she managed to repair and put new tires on a truck that she later sold.  Her family group is the same, but their financial condition and economic circumstances have changed.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to season, chickens to fatten, chicken feed, firewood, and vaccines, and to pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Mario  Alfredo

texts.es: Don Mario de 41 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia el se dedica a la albañileria desde hace 10 años, con el trabajo que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don Mario desea mejorar su vivienda pero no tiene suficiente capital para realizarlo porque con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos por eso solicita un credito que le permita cambiar el techo de su vivienda para que el y su familia puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en: Mario is 41 years old and he lives with his wife and three children in a house they own. He has been a construction worker for 10 years and with the work he does, he pays for household expenses. Mario wishes to improve his house but he lacks enough capital to do so because he doesn't make enough money to cover that expense. This is why he is asking for a loan that will allow him to change the roof in his house so that he and his family can live better.

loans.use: to improve his house by building the roof.

loans.name: Lemeria

texts.en:
Lemeria, now married, has successfully paid off his previous loan, due in part to the easily accessible animal feed in the rainy season. He has used the proceeds to diversify his business to include bean farming. 

He has acquired another loan of 35,000 KES, which will enable him to increase his animal numbers. The business is doing well due to the easy and cheap access to animal feed in the rainy season.

He will use the increased proceeds to meet the young family's basic needs, as well as expand his business. His hope is to raise a healthy and wealthy family, with highly educated children.

loans.use: to purchase animals for resale

loans.name: Ely Antonio

texts.es: Don Ely de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años siembra frijol y maiz cuando sus cosechas ya estan listas las va almacenando en los graneros que muestra la fotografia y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su familia en casa propia. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas como: semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos entre otras cosas que le sirvan para su cosecha ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Ely, 33, has made a living in agriculture for five years.  He grows beans and corn.  When his harvests are ready he stores them in the silo seen in the photograph.  With the sales he makes he manages to pay the household expenses.

He's a responsible, honest, and hardworking man.  He lives with his family in his own house.

He's requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural inputs such as seed, fertilizer, pesticide, soil amendments, and other things he needs for his harvest, because what he earns isn't enough to cover those expenses.  This way he'll have better income and greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, seed, soil amendments, etc.

loans.name: Johel

texts.es:
Johel, se dedica a la venta de sorbetes por menor y mayor. El tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 30 años de edad, disfruta de un hijo de 5 años de edad; Johel, posee desde hace tres años el negocio y lo realiza de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar sorbetes, conos, paletas, entre otro tipo de helados; este le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Johel sells sorbets wholesale and retail. He is 32 years old, and married. His wife, who is 30 years old, has a 5-year-old son.
Johel has owned his business for three years and he works there from Monday to Saturday.
The loan will allow him to purchase sorbets, iced cones, and popsicles among other ice creams. This will allow him to increase his stock and improve his income.
His dream is to reinforce his business and provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase sorbets, ice cream cones, popsicles and other ice creams.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 62 years old and married with five children.

Salome works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, soap, sugar and other groceries.

Salome has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Salome aspires to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, soap, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia  tiene 38 años de edad, esta soltera. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde los nueve años aprendió el oficio de elaborar tortillas; su madre fue quien le enseño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para construir una habitación en donde instalara su cocina; ya que le toca elaborar las tortillas en el corredor de su casa. Así, ella distribuirá mejor el espacio y tendrá una mejor higiene al tener todo en su lugar y que los clientes se puedan sentir mejor y más cómodos. Su deseo es que su negocio crezca para aumentar sus ingresos y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y enseñarles a sus sobrinos para que sigan con el negocio.
texts.en:
Natalia is 38 years old and single. She is an enterprising woman who learned the skill of making tortillas some 9 years ago. Her Mother taught her.

The loan she is soliciting through Fundacion Campo is for purchasing materials to construct a residence in which a kitchen can be installed. She needs this because at present, she has to make her tortillas in the corridor of her house. This will better distribute her space and result in improved hygiene by having everything in its place. And her customers will feel better and more comfortable. 

Natalia's desire is that her business should grow in order to augment her income, making it possible to improve her home and teach her nephews and nieces so that they can continue the business.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a house in which she can install a kitchen, because now, she is having to make tortillas in the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 44 años de edad en un estado civil (unión libre) y madre de 7 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian en y los otros tres están independizados de la familia. Uno tiene 17 años está estudiando en tercer curso en la secundaria, otro 15 años está en segundo curso de la secundaria, el de 12 años está en sexto grado de la primaria y la menor de 10 años esta encuarto grado en la primaria. Ellos me ayudan con el cultivo de café como ser: limpieza, abonar y corte de la cosecha. Las tierras que ella cultiva son obtenidas por herencia por parte de sus padres por lo que trabaja junto a su familia tratando día con día de mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos. Ella tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad fue inculcada por sus padres desde muy joven. Las tierras que cultivan están ubicadas a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación por lo cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono y bombas para fumigar sus cultivos ya que esto evitara que sus cultivos de contaminen y la cosecha se pierda en su totalidad.

Su deseos son los de mejorar su estilo de vida, el de sus hijos mediante el estudio y como meta mediante esta solicitud poder comprar los insumos para que su cultivo no se contamine, obteniendo mayores ganancias, mejores ingresos para su familia y poder cubrir con los gastos del estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a 44-year-old woman who is in a common-law marriage. She is the mother of seven children, of whom four are in school; the rest are now living independently from the family. One is 17 years old and in the third year of secondary school. Another, who is 15 years old, is in the second year of secondary school. The 12-year-old is in the sixth grade of primary school, and the youngest, who is 10 years old, is in the fourth grade of primary school. They help her with the coffee farming by weeding, fertilizing, and harvesting. The land that she cultivates was inherited from her parents, so she works together with her family trying every day to improve their quality of life and income. She has been earning her living in this business for more than twenty years; it was instilled in her by her parents starting at a very young age. The land that she farms is located at a distance of about two kilometers from her house, so she travels to it on foot every day.

Currently, she is requesting help in order to purchase fertilizers, soil amendments, and pumps for fumigating her crops; this will prevent her crops from being contaminated, which would cause her to lose her entire harvest.

Her wish is to improve her quality of life and that of her children through education; the objective for this loan request is for her to be able to purchase supplies to keep her crop free of disease, thereby obtaining greater profits and better income for her family, enabling her to cover her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, soil amendments, and pumps for fumigating her coffee crops.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Don fernando de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, el  se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 23 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijoles cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros y sacos que muestra la fotografía  para luego salir a comercializarlos con los que venden granos básicos en los mercados de los diferentes departamentos del pais con las ventas de sus cosechas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar pero no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de su  siembra por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comparar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener una mejor cosecha y así tener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Fernando is 52 years old, and lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 15 and 18 years old.  He has worked as a farmer for 23 years.  His main crops are corn and beans.  When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the barns in the sacks shown in the photograph to later sell with those who sell basic grains in the markets in the different departments of the country.  The sales of his harvests allow him to meet his household expenses but not to cover the costs of planting, so he is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, and other items to have a better harvest.  This will allow him to earn more income to give his family what they need without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Ingrid Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ingrid, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella vive con su familia, su madre y sus hijos; el negocio lo aprendió de la misma familia, este lo realiza de lunes a domingo de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm, la dificultad es que el local donde posee el puesto lo alquila.
El préstamo que solicita le servirá para comprar mercadería tales como: blusas, pantalones, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros; este le ayudara para tener mejor inventario y así lograr vender más.
Su sueño es tener  variedad de mercadería para ofrecerles a los clientes.
texts.en:
Ingrid works selling clothing.  She lives with her family, her mother, and her children.  She learned the business from her family.  She works from Monday to Sunday from 6:00am to 6:00pm.  Her challenge is that the store where she has her post is rented.

She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as: shirts, pants, t-shirts, and other clothing items for women and men.  This will help her have better inventory and be able to sell more.  Her dream is to have more variety of merchandise to offer to customers.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, t-shirts, and other clothing items.

loans.name: German Enrique

texts.es: Don German de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, German se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Don German solicita un credito que le permita porder comprar los insumos agricolas que necesita como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, y tambien para mejorar el terreno donde siembra para poder obtener mejores cosechas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
German is 39 years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their two children.  German has worked as a farmer for several years.  His main crop is corn.  The sales that he makes from his harvests are able to cover his household expenses.  

German is requesting this loan in order to purchase farming supplies that he needs such as manure, seeds, fertilizers, and also to improve the land where he plants in order to obtain better harvests so that he can have better income and give his family a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Glendy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glendy, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la panadería, ya  que el oficio al cual él se dedica es a la elaboración de pan; este le permitirá comprar harina, azúcar, sal, manteca, leña, entre otros productos necesarios.
El crédito anterior le permitió a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas han cambiado y las circunstancias familiares se han optmizado.
texts.en:
Glendy needs to request a new loan to continue investing in her bakery.  She works making bread, and this loan will allow her to purchase flour, sugar, salt, butter, firewood, and other necessary products.

Her last loan allowed her to increase her inventory and earn a better income.  Her financial situation has changed and her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, salt, butter, firewood, and other necessary products.

loans.name: Sharon Mae

texts.en:
Sharon Mae is 34 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Sharon Mae has a hardware business and is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase construction supplies to sell in her hardware store.

She has been in this business for 15 years. Sharon Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to sell in her hardware store.

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
Amabel is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother to three young children from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She has raised hogs as a business for more than two years. Her husband works as a driver.

Amabel is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and sell. She hopes to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Amabel hopes to make her business successful and sustainable. Also, she wants to save money for her children’s education and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Donard

texts.en: This marks Donard's third business loan to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes, and bananas for sale. He is currently operating a green banana store while his wife runs a greengrocer business. He has repaid his past loans successfully, and hopes to continue to be a loyal client at KADET LTD for his business financing.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years. Marilou also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing 28,000 PHP to buy more groceries to sell in her store. 

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to buy more land for her farm.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ledi

texts.en:
Ledi is 22 years old and lives in Mukhiani in the Tskaltubo district with her 25-year-old husband, mother-in-law and one year old son. Ledi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business, but her loan request was rejected every time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Their main source of the income is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a plot of agricultural land to grow greens. The cow’s milk is used to make dairy products which are sold with the harvested greens at the local markets. Ledi’s husband is an artisan and he works on private orders for a small monthly salary. 

Ledi was approved for a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. With her credit, Ledi will purchase all the needed materials to build a greenhouse where she will grow vegetables that will be sold at the local markets. Ledi will then be able to earn additional income for the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase all  needed materials to build a greenhouse that will be used to grow greens to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 55 years old and has one of her children is in school.

Susan has a business preparing and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to souse and dry for sale.

Susan has been in this business for five years. In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to souse and dry for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 29 years old, a married man with one child who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Abdullah completed studying law in college. Now he is working in the military forces and receiving a low salary.  

Abdullah has saved a small amount of money but does not have enough to buy what he needs. He applied for a youth loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy a television to use in his home. He hopes to improve his living standards

loans.use: to buy a television for household use.

loans.name: Farzana Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 44-year-old, hard-working and diligent woman. She has three children and her husband works in a wood shop.

Farzana has completed various beautician courses and she is an excellent beautician by profession. She has been running her own beauty salon for 20 years. She is very skilled and an independent woman and she is helping her husband by running her own business. She spends all of her income generated from the business on the education of children so that they can have a bright future.

Currently she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, as a member of a two-person lending group. She would like to expand her business by adding one more room to her salon. Her clients are increasing day by day and current space is too congested. She would also like to purchase more cosmetic products, such as lipsticks, facial scrubs, etc and also some new hair stylers. This loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. NOTE: In the picture, Farzana is raising her hand.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 43-year-old cafe owner in Mikindani, Mombasa. She is married, and is the mother of three school-going children. She has been in this business for the last six years and has done great.

This marks her third borrowing from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase a microwave, sacks of potatoes, cooking fat and soft drinks. 

She will use the anticipated profit to service her loan and expand her business. She hopes to own several cafes in town.

loans.use: to purchase a microwave and food stocks such as sacks of potatoes, cooking fat and soft drinks.

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en: Waseem is 29 years old. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. His education qualification is a bachelor's degree. He is a good merchant who works hard to earn his daily income. He has been operating a small grocery store for two years. He says that the business has not been running well because he does not have money to expand his business so as to attract more customers. Due to this he has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy grocery items to use for his business. With this loan he hopes to increase his profits and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in his business.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is 22 years old, married with two children and lives in the Philippines. She earns a living by raising and selling pigs and has been in this business for four years.

Cheryll is borrowing 11,000 PHP  to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 55 años de edad felizmente casada y de su matrimonio tiene 2 hijos los cuales depende y viven con ella. María tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el 1 grado ella no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus padres eran de muy bajos recursos y no pudieron seguirla apoyando. Ella y su esposo se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz, frijoles y café por mucho tiempo producto que es comercializado y vendido en pequeña escala en el mercado local, y con los vecinos y fue su esposo quien le enseño dicha actividad. La tierra que maría trabaja es propia y le agradece a DIOS por eso y por todo lo que a diario le da.

Hoy en día maría solicita ayuda para poder comprar semilla certificada y abono para cultivar más café de esta manera ella podrá sembrar una mayor cantidad ya que de esta forma lograra que su cosecha sea más productiva y sana.

Sus metas y sueños son poder incrementar sus cultivos de esa forma obtendría más ingresos para su hogar y su familia pudiendo seguir ayudando con los gastos de la canasta básica a su esposo, pero como prioridad lograr que sus hijos se pueda también preparar como profesionales a nivel universitario que tengan una mejor educación, mejores oportunidades de empleo y ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
María, 55, is happily married and has two dependent children from that marriage who live with her.  María studied up to the first grade; she wasn't able to continue studying because her parents didn't have the resources to help her.

She and her husband have made a living for a long time growing basic staples such as corn, beans, and coffee, which they sell on a small scale in the local market and to neighbors.  Her husband taught her this job.  The land María works is her own.  She's grateful to God for that and for everything He gives her every day.

Currently María's requesting help to be able to buy certified seed and soil amendments to grow more coffee.  This way she'll be able to plant a greater quantity and get a more productive and healthy crop.

Her goals and dreams are to be able to increase her crops, get more income for her household and her family, and continue helping her husband with the expenses for staple items.  But her priority is for her children to become professionals at the university level and have a better education and job opportunities, and be better every day.

loans.use: to buy certified seed and soil amendments to grow coffee

loans.name: Abduvoris

texts.ru:
Абдуворис является водителем в одной из частных школ, он развозит с утра до вечера детишек из дома до школы и обратно.   Ему нравиться эта работа так как родители спокойны за своих детей и они каждый день ему благодарны за то, что Абдуворис облегчил им жизнь, так как многие родители работают и с работы выйти очень трудно. Абдуворис является оптимальным вариантом для транспортировки школьников.
 Абдуворис давно хочет отремонтировать свой дом,особенно крышу дома, так как в прошлом году весной из за сильных дождей крыша протекала. Ему пришлось очень не легко. 
Предыдущий кредит он успешно погасил и теперь подал заявку на следующий.  На полученный  кредит  хочет купить шифер и поменять крышу своего дома.
texts.en:
Abduvoris works as a driver for a private school. Every day he drives children from their homes to the school and back. He likes this work as it allows parents  to feel that their children are safe. The parents thank Abduvoris every day for making their lives easier, as many parents work and it’s very hard for them to get out of work [to pick up their children]. Therefore, the service Abduvoris provides is the best  transportation option for schoolchildren.
For a long time, Abduvoris have been wanting to renovate his house, in particular his roof, since last year the roof had leaks due to heavy rain. This was very hard for him. He has successfully repaid his prior loan and applied for the next one. He would like to use his loan to buy slate and replace his roofing.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her children and husband. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and he loves his family and claims they are his greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income. 

At present his rickshaw has stopped working, and because of that he is not able to generate any income to meet the needs of his family. He wants to fix the rickshaw as soon as possible as it is the only source of income for his family. 

Fozia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. The loan amount will help her husband to fix his rickshaw so that he can continue his business. 

Her house is under construction, but because construction material is expensive they haven't been able to complete it. Therefore with the profit amount Fozia wishes to complete the construction of her house. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her family.

loans.use: to fix her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Mrs. Shabana is a housewife with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder.  

Shabana has requested a loan amount of 20,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is taking a loan for her husband to buy welding materials such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods and iron sheets. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household necessities. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 43 years old and married with four children. Two children are in school. They live in the Philippines.

Mary Jane raises livestock and has been in the business for eight years now. She borrowed four times in the past to sustain her business. Mary Jane has requested a 14,000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
Davlat is 50 years old, married with three children. He works hard every day to generate enough income to cover his daily needs and to send all of his children to school.

Davlat grows wheat and watermelon on his own land and is a dedicated farmer.  He works hard from early morning until late in the evening and has done so for years.

Davlat would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 3000 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Lucia from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with four children. Three children are attending school. She also cares for one dependent. 

Lucia runs a clothing retail business. The business has been in operation for 13 years. Lucia has requested a loan of $800 to buy more clothing for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children, and take them to better schools. In the future, Lucia wants to employ other people to assist her in running her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yonas

texts.en:
Yonas is a 51 year old man, and married to Eleunike, age 47.  They have been blessed with five children: Ricky, who is 19, graduated from senior high school; Riwie, who is 16, and a senior high school student.  Bryan, age 13; Yeroen, age nine and Dastian, who is six years old attend elementary school.
 
He repairs couches and has been in business since 1989.  He started the business with limited capital.  Due to increased customer demand, he is seeking more capital. 

Yonas received information that TLM provides business loans to those who want to improve their business.  He plans to spend the loan amount to buy material and to start up another business raising piglets.  He has requested a loan amount of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to buy material and to raise piglets.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 48 years old, and she lives with her children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

She has been rendering transportation service to local people within districts of Ulaanbaatar and attracts quite a number of customer to her service.  Narantuya is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

The house her family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repairs.  So, she is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to purchase bricks, vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass and cement.  Those materials will help insulate her house and provide warmer and more comfortable living conditions for her children. 

The renovated house will enable her family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and contribute to ongoing efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass and cement.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Charles from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. He is widower with one child, who attends school. He also cares for one dependent. 

Charles runs a retail business where he sells men's clothing. The business has been in operation for seven years. Charles has requested a loan of $500 to buy more winter wear clothing. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his family's standard of living. 

In the future, Charles plans to own a big shop. He says the main challenge he faces is the lack of working capital.

loans.use: to buy more winter wear clothing to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Saima Group

texts.en:
Saimais (center) is 36 years old and a hard working mother of three children.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and children. 

She is a very skilled woman and an expert at stitching up dresses.  Saimais has tailored garments from 7 years.  All the people in her area are very satisfied and happy with her work.  She provides her services at a very reasonable cost and her work seems to increase day by day.

Saima, a member of three person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.  She wants to expand her business by purchasing a sewing machine.  She would be able to stitch dresses in less time with a new sewing machine.  This will increase her net income and savings.  She plans to spend the profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old interior decorator from Maweni, Mombasa.  She is a married mother of three and has been in business for the last four years.  Alice is doing well.

This marks Alice's second loan from KADET LTD, to finance her business.  She will use the loan to purchase clothing material needed to make pillow cases, window curtains and table cloths for resale.  She plans to use her profits to repay the loan and expand her business.

Alice hopes to win a lot of tenders (bids) for interior decorations in the hotel industry, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material needed to make pillow cases, window curtains and table cloths.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 34 years old. She lives in Sachkhere District, with her parents and brother. Maia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Maia works as a nurse, looks after a child, and has a small monthly income. Her father and brother work as artisans, locally. Together, they make hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Maia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Maia has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With this credit, Maia will rent a commercial space and open a clothing shop. She will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell them in her shop. The new business initiative will significantly increase the monthly income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a commercial space and sell clothes

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Angeline, from Harare, the capital city of Zimbabwe. She is widowed and has two children, one attending school. She also cares for one other dependent. Angeline runs a retail business where she sells clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main business challenge she faces is a lack of working capital.

Angeline has requested a loan of $800 to buy more clothes and footwear to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future Angeline plans to own a flea market.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and footwear to resell at her shop

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina, a widow, works hard to support her family. She has a hog-raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  She will use the loan to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. Merlina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jaime Misrain

texts.es: Jaime es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la va almacenando en los sacos que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a venderlos a los comerciantes de granos basicos con las ganacias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Jaime desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas y tambien para mejorar el terreno donde cosecha, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jaime is a man who is very responsible with his household obligations; he has always been known for providing the best to his children. He currently lives together with his wife and their three children. He earns his living as a farmer, planting corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the sacks that appear in the photograph so that he can then go sell it to staple crop traders. With the earnings that he receives from his sales, he manages to cover his household expenses. 

Jaime hopes to increase his sales, so he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies; it will also permit him to improve the land that he harvests, so that he can keep putting food on the table every day.

loans.use: to purchase soil amendments, fertilizers, seeds, etc., and to make improvements to his land.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Patricia, from Harare. She is married and has two children, one attending school.  Patricia runs a retail clothing business. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges that she faces are a lack of working capital, and increased competition.

Patricia has requested a loan of $750 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve her family's standard of living. Patricia plans to own a big clothing shop, in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Sayvaly

texts.en:
Sayvaly is 43 years old. He is a hardworking and kind man. He is married and has four children.  Two of them are adults, and two of them are not yet adults. Sayvaly is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to his children. He began his own business, dealing in animal husbandry, 10 years ago. His wife helps him with the business.

Sayvaly wants to develop the business and increase its profit. From the profits he plans to buy all necessary things for his children.  He requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni, which he will use to buy more cattle for later resale at a profit. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan, since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for later resale at a profit

loans.name: Azeed

texts.en:
Mrs. Azeed is a hardworking housewife with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her children and husband. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He loves his family and claims they are his greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income.

Presently, his rickshaw has stopped working. Because of that, he is not able to generate any income to meet the needs of his family. He wants to fix the rickshaw as soon as possible, because this is the only source of income for his family. Mrs. Azeed has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. The loan amount will help her husband to fix and maintain his rickshaw, so that he can continue his business. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her family.

loans.use: to fix her husband's rickshaw, which has stopped working

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, shortening, salt, and other products.

loans.name: Karla Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karla tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora que a la edad de 15 años; empezó a incursionar en el negocio instalando una pequeña tienda en su casa; por si sola aprendió como hacerlo con un dinero que recibió y desde entonces empezó a invertir. Cada 8 días compra la mercadería para vender en su tienda, como fríjoles, arroz, maíz, azúcar, etc. Y para la cafetería.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas mercadería para surtir la tienda y para invertir en el comercio de venta de ropa que desde hace dos años ha  dado inicio. De esta manera, podrá tener disponible el dinero que necesita para invertir en su negocio y aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta de fortalecer su negocio; para alcanzar una estabilidad económica para su familia y brindar a sus hijos educación. Al tener un negocio más fortalecido, podrá expandirse a otros lugares y sus hijos podrá empezar a ayudarle con la administración.
texts.en:
Karla, 32, is married and has two children.

She's an enterprising woman who at the age of 15 began to get involved in business, installing a small store in her house.  She learned how to do it on her own with some money she received, and since then began to invest.  Every eight days she buys merchandise to sell in her store as well as for the coffee shop, such as beans, rice, corn, sugar, etc.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy more merchandise to stock her store as well as to invest in her business selling clothing that she started two years ago.

This way she'll be able to have the money available to invest in her business and make the most of the opportunity to strengthen her business.  She'll achieve economic stability for her family and give her children an education.  With a strengthened business she'll be able to expand to other locations and her children will be able to begin to help her with the management.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and to invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es:
Jessenia, de 34 años de edad , vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia.El trabajo de Jessenia consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas los cuales son de distintas marcas y sabores. Cuenta con una refrigeradora; también hace helados de frutas de la región como de camu-camu, aguaje, coco entre otros. Realiza este trabajo en un local en el interior de su hogar. Comenzó esta actividad al ver que a sus vecinos les iba bien vendiendo estos productos.Lleva 3 años en esta actividad económica. Considera rentable este negocio por el alto consumo de bebidas y por sus helados  de frutas naturales.Al inicio de su actividad era importante tener donde conservar sus productos, pero no contaba con una refrigeradora. Ahorro un poco de dinero, entonces adquirió su tan preciado electrodoméstico en donde conserva y produce sus helados.
Espera posteriormente consolidar su trabajo, empezar a producir en mayor cantidad y tener más variabilidad de bebidas.Por tanto este será su préstamo número 6 con Kiva y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado .
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles comprará bebidas gasificadas de distintas marcas .
texts.en:
Jessenia, 34, lives with her husband in the home they own. Jessenia's job is selling sodas of different flavors and brands. She has a refrigerator. She also makes frozen treats with fruits from the region like camu-camu, aguaje (moriche palm), and coconut. She works from inside her home. She started her business because she saw that it was going well for her neighbors who sold these products. She has been doing it for 3 years and considers it profitable due to the high consumption of sodas and because of her natural fruit popsicles. At the beginning it was important to have a place to store her products, but she didn't have a refrigerator. She saved some money and got her precious appliance where she stores and makes her ice creams.

She hopes later to consolidate her work and begin to produce in greater quantity and stock a greater variety of sodas. That is what she will use her 6th Kiva loan for and she is very grateful for the support.

With the requested 1200 soles she will buy different brands of sodas.

loans.use: to buy sodas.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 47 años, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Julia consiste en la venta de de bebidas gasificadas como son gaseosas de distintos sabores  y cervezas de marcas diferentes. Cuenta con una refrigeradora para mantenerlas heladas , lleva 6 años en  esta actividad la cual realiza en un local que esta en el interior de su vivienda. Su esposo se encarga cada día de comprar para abastecer su negocio. Este trabajo le genera ganancias porque en este tiempo la temperatura esta muy alta en la ciudad y los clientes consumen bebidas en mayor proporción. 
Comenta que cuando empezó su negocio  compraba de revendedores a precios altos. Pero al pasar el tiempo fue  conociendo las distintas distribuidoras que dan el producto a menor precio, entonces empezó a incrementar  sus ganancias económicas.Este es el sexto préstamo con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado .
Con el monto solicitado de 500 soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas al por mayor para asi incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Julia, 47, is married and has 5 children with whom she lives in the home they own. Julia sells sodas of different flavors and various brands of beer. She has a refrigerator to keep them cold. She has been doing this business for 6 years, running it out of her home. Her husband is in charge of buying enough to stock the store each day. It is profitable work because in this season it is very hot in the city and people consume a lot more drinks. She says that when she started her business she bought from retailers at high prices, but over time she got to know the different distributors that give her the product at a lower price. That way her profits began to increase. This is her 6th Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the support.

With the requested 500 soles she will buy sodas in bulk to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sodas.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 40 years old. He lives in Gardabani district with his wife, a brother, his retired mother and his son. Shota requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a grocery shop and a second-hand clothes shop. Their additional income is Shota’s mother’s monthly pension. 

Shota requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Shota has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Shota will purchase chicks. After the chicks are grown, he will sell them at a good price and earn additional income for the family. Shota is a very hardworking man, and he wants to develop his poultry business. To do so, he will work hard and reinvest the profit in the same field. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give Shota the opportunity to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase chicks.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don julio de 33 años de edad vive con esposa y su hijo de 4 años vive en casa propia, Don julio es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor, hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado con el cual se dedica a producir y vender productos lácteos en su lugar de residencia. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y alimentos para el ganado y  para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Don Julio is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four-year-old child. He is a hardworking, responsible, and enterprising gentleman. For the past eight years, he has been raising cattle for producing and selling dairy products from his home. Julio has a very good clientele since he has been able to earn the trust of his customers. He offers quality products at good prices.

Julio has decided to invest in the care of his livestock since his business is dependent on them. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy vitamins and feed for his cattle. He will also buy a dairy cow so that he can grow his business. With this loan, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue providing necessary financial assistance to his household.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, livestock feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 35 years old and a widow. Her two children are ages 7 and 9 years old. She owns a stationery shop and has been in operation for a period of 3 years, earning an income of 18,900 Kenya shillings (KES). She also rears poultry in her farm.

Faith is now servicing her second loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase poultry feeds and also purchase stock of stationery. The anticipated amounts will be used to support her stationery shop.

Her dream is to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery and buy  and  poultry feeds

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy vaccines, feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Africano

texts.en:
Africano, at the age of 50, had never thought of having a permanent house because he has to take his children to school and also take care of the family's day-to-day needs. He has, however, worked hard on his coffee plantation and he now sees his dream coming true.

Africano currently has a plan of acquiring more land from the neighborhood, on which he will construct a permanent house. He hopes to get a loan of 3,000,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited to enable him achieve his dream. The first step to building a permanent house will be acquiring this piece of land.

He is happy to have funders who can enable people like him to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: To buy more land for constructing a permanent house.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 42 years old, and she is a hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and ten children. Only two of her children are going to school because of the financial constraints, as she can’t afford the educational expenses of all. Her husband is a wood cutter by profession and he has a very low monthly income.

Nasreen is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for 7 years. Her clients are very satisfied with her work.

Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center and needs to purchase two new sewing machines. She will reinvest the profit amount on her business and use a part of it to pay for educational expenses. She desires to send all of her children to school. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a progressive one for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for stitching dresses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 21 years old. She lives in the small village of Sachkhere District with her parents and brother. Mariam requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows and 0.75 hectare of agricultural land. They produce dairy products to sell locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mariam requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Mariam has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Mariam will purchase all the needed equipment, rent a commercial space and open a beauty salon. She had been working in a beauty salon and is very experienced in this field. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly increase the monthly income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and pay rent for her new beauty salon

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Oumar est un marchand ambulant de 39 ans, qui s’active depuis plusieurs années car il a démarré depuis l’âge de 20 ans. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Oumar vend des ustensiles de cuisine et emploie même la méthode des femmes pour la récupération journalière (il donne la marchandise à crédit et passe chaque jour récupérer). Il travaille de 9h à 18h. Avec le crédit, il pourra augmenter et diversifier le stock dont il dispose. Il gère la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Il a comme projet futur, d’ouvrir un magasin de vente d’ustensiles et d’offrir à la clientèle une gamme de produits au choix.
texts.en:
Oumar is a travelling vendor. He's 39 years old and has been working in business since he was 20. He is married and has four children. Oumar sells kitchen utensils and uses the method employed by women to collect his payments on a daily basis (he sells the products on credit and then returns everday to collect payment). He works from 9am to 6pm. With the loan, he can increase his inventory. He manages all the family expenses.
In the future, he would like to open his own store and offer his customers a large variety of kitchen items.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mbaye qui habite à quelques mètre de l'IMCEC,agé de 44 ans est un immigré qui travaille en Espagne dans un hotel,du mois de Mai au mois d'Octobre.Il revient au Sénégal ou il fait du commerce en vendant du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe.
Marié et père de 8 enfants,il travaille de 8h à 18h.Il prend en charge sa famille:ses parents et ses frères.
texts.en: Mbaye lives a few metres away from the UIMCEC branch. He is 44 years old and is an immigrant worker in a hotel in Spain from May to October. He then returns to Senegal where he sells charcoal and firewood. Married and the father of 8 children, he works from 8 o'clock in the morning to 6 o'clock at night. He takes care of his family; his parents and his brothers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata âgée de 34 ans, habite à quelques mètres de l’IMCEC, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle évolue dans le commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle achète des tissus dans la capitale pour venir revendre dans sa région. Avec les bénéfices générés, elle épargne une partie et le reste elle renforce son fond de commerce avec. Elle aide dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Comme projet futurs elle aimerait ouvrir une cantine et avoir ses propres employés.
texts.en: Aminata, who is 34 years old, lives a few metres from the UIMCEC branch. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a retailer for 5 years. She buys fabric in the capital and resells it in her region. Part of the profits generated by her business are saved and the rest is used to strengthen her business. She also helps manage the family's daily expenditures. Her future plans include opening a small stall at the market and having her own employees.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabric for resale.

loans.name: René Gana

texts.fr:
Monsieur René Gana est un jeune taximan qui loge à quelques kilomètres du guichet de l’IMCEC. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants et évolue dans le secteur du transport depuis 2 ans. Il possède un taxi-clando qui roule de Thiès à Fandène. Il vient solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA afin d’acheter un moteur et réparer son véhicule.  Avec les revenus tirés de ce transfert il épargne et avec le reste il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer.
Il a un objectif, celui d’acquérir un autre véhicule pour maximiser ses profits.
texts.en: René Gana is a young taxi driver who lives a few kilometres from the UIMCEC branch. He is married and the father of 2 children, and has been working in the transportation sector for 2 years. He owns a taxi "clando" (local private car used for public transport) which he runs between Thiès and Fandène. He is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs in order to buy an engine so that he can fix his car. He will use part of the revenues he earns thanks to this loan to build his savings and will use the rest to take care of his household's daily expenditures. He has one goal, and that is to buy another vehicle so that he can maximise his profits.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his "clando" (local private car used for public transport).

loans.name: Book Diom 31 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Book Diom 31 regroupe 6 personnes dont 2 hommes et 4 femmes. Ils s’activent tous dans le commerce et cela depuis longtemps. La responsable du groupe, la dame Tola, mariée et mère de famille, a acquis une expérience de 25 ans. Elle évolue dans la vente de divers : habits, charbon, bois de chauffe… et tout autre produit dont la vente est susceptible de généré un bénéfice. Elle travaille de 7h à 18h du soir. Grace au crédit, elle pourra diversifier ses produits et services mais aussi mettre un peu d’argent de coté. Tola rêve de devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en: The loan group Book Diom 31 groups together 6 people; 2 men and 4 women. They have all been retailers for a long time. The group's leader, Tola, is married and a mother and has built up 25 years of experience. She sells various items including clothing, charcoal and firewood, and any other item likely to make a profit. She works from 7 o'clock in the morning to 6 o'clock in the evening. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to diversify her products and services and also put some money into savings. Tola dreams of becoming a large retailer.

loans.use: to buy various products like wood, charcoal, firewood and clothing.

loans.name: Bokk Diom 32 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Book Diom 32 est constitué de 6 membres dont 2 hommes et 4 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. L e président s’appelle Moustapha. Il est marié et père de famille. Monsieur Moustapha évolue dans le secteur du maraichage depuis maintenant 10 ans. Il possède un champ qu’il veut exploiter pleinement grâce au crédit de groupe que leur a octroyé l’IMCEC. Grace aux bénéfices requis, il gère son foyer et leur dépense quotidienne.
Il désire devenir un grand cultivateur et diversifier son activité en y associant l’élevage.
texts.en:
The loan group Bokk Diom 32 is made up of six members: two men and four women who live in the same area. The president is named Moustapha. He is married and the father of a family. Monsieur Moustapha has performed truck farming for 10 years now. He has a field that he wants to farm fully thanks to the group loan granted to them by UIMCEC. Thanks to the profits received, he manages his household and its everyday expenses. 
He wants to become a major farmer and diversify his business by adding livestock farming to it.

loans.use: to buy seeds to farm his field

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.es: Yonatan tiene 22 años de edad y  es soltero, él nació en la ciudad de Saylla y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad donde nació.  Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, él también estudia administración de empresa en una universidad de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Yonatan en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos y gallinas. Su sueño es  abrir una empresa y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Yonatan is 22 years old and single.  He was born in the city of Saylla and still lives there.  

Yonatan raises small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  He is also studying Business Administration at a university in the city of Cusco.  Yonatan has been raising animals for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy chickens and hens.  His dream is to open a business and become a professional.
